, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term Maya has been translated as 'illusion,' but then it does not concern\nnormal illusion.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here 'illusion' does\nnot mean that the world is not real and simply a figment of the human\nimagination.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya means that the\nworld is not as it seems; the world that one experiences is misleading as far\nas its true nature is concerned it is to say, instead, that it is not what it\nseems to be, that it is something constantly being made<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Upanishads, MAYA is the perceived changing reality and it co-exists with Brahman which is the\nhidden true reality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE BASE TEMPLATE OF\nADVAITA ( BRAHMAN ) IS REAL. THE SUPERIMPOSED SECOND TEMPLATE OF DVAITA (\nTRINITY ) AND THIRD TEMPLATE OF SANKHYA ( PURUSHA / PRAGATI ) ARE IN CONSTANT\nFLUX<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BrahmAn (&nbsp; the FIELD ) cannot be seen or picked up by\nthe 5 human senses.&nbsp; BrahmAn works beyond\nthe quantum screen.&nbsp; The quantum screen\nis a form of veil of Maya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However brahmAn allows\nhimself to be picked up by the 5 human senses by his DVAITA VEDANTA 2nd\ntemplate. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindu gods Brahma /\nVishnu and Shiva are parts of brahmAn , the field \u2014they are cosmic forces.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These three cosmic\nforces have been personalized for the lower three varnas who has NO access to\nthe Vedas which dealt with brahmAn.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The TRINITY ( rajas\n\u2013creator&nbsp; / Sattwa- mediator / Tamas-\ndestroyer&nbsp;&nbsp; ) cosmic forces of Brahma \u2013\nVishnu- Shiva , are not mortals .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahma and Shiva\ncontrols the actions as CREATOR- DESTROYER<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vi\u1e63h\u1e47u as the\nPRESERVER/ MEDIATOR / SUSTAINER is the master of maya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tamas \u2013 Rajas ( Shiva \u2013\nBrahma )&nbsp; , which are rooted together ,\nis present in every phenomenon on earth., where energy transforms from one to\nanother\u2014it can neither be created or destroyed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These two opposing\nforces are natural and transform each other , in perfect harmony.&nbsp; Harmony can never be stagnant .&nbsp; Lessening of Tamas always results in increase\nof Rajas and vice versa<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One cannot exist\nwithout the other and they are dependant .&nbsp;\nNo phenomenon in this universe is completely devoid of its\nopposite.&nbsp; They consume each other yet\nsupport each other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whatever is in excess\ngets reduces, whatever is deficient gets replenished.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Balance can never be\npermanent\u2014 Tamas and Rajas continiously devour each other \u2013 and life flows on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You must ponder over\neach waxing-waning cycle to appreciate the absolute truth . They keep each\nother in check, yet provide fuel to feed off each other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tamas creates Rajas,\nand Rajas activates/ excites Tamas. Tamas influences Rajas not only from inside\nbut also from outside.. they are rooted together.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Few examples of this\neternal cycle of inter dependant reversal and immediate exchange are:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Black hole/ quasar<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Day/night<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscious/ subconscious<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Winter/ summer<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aerobic bacteria/\nanaerobic<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Catabolism/ anabolism<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potential energy/\nkinetic energy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Evaporation/\ncondensation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxidation/\nantioxidation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Attraction/ repulsion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gather / disperse<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excitation/ inhibition<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Absorbsion/ secretion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contraction/ relaxation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acid/ base<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Positive pole/ negative<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Counterclockwise\nvortex/ clockwise<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sleep/ wake<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Freezing/ melting<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaporisation/\ncondensation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ionisation/\ndeionisation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Energy/ matter<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Birth/ decay<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cathode/ anode<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Static/ Dynamic<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organic / Inorganic<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gravity / Antigravity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The phenomenal world\noperates under maya, the law of duality or oppositional states-&nbsp;<b>&nbsp; Srimad Bhagavatam, verse 3.26.4:[1] 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAYA is the veritable\nfabric of duality, and she performs this role at the behest of BrahmAn, the\nmorphogenetic consciousness field..&nbsp;&nbsp; The\nSupreme God is not bound by Maya&nbsp; just as\nmagicians do not believe the illusions of their own magic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our 5 senses serve as a\nfilter allowing us to experience only what is absolutely necessary for our\nphysical existence.&nbsp; The 5 senses create\nthe set for the stage we call our lives.&nbsp;\nThe senses squelch out , let we will have a breakdown due to excess\ninformation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya is invisible\nand&nbsp; beyond sense-perception. No human\ncan see beyond the quantum screen .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dvaita Hinduism tells\nus about the duality of nature and existence .&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These dual poles of\nTamas \u2013Rajas are connected via consciousness.&nbsp;\nIt is about the quantum possibility wave vibration between two poles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This guarantees change,\ngrowth and evolution Lessening of Rajas always results in increase of Tamas and\nvice versa.&nbsp; One cannot exist without the\nother and they are mutually dependant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Leela or divine play ,\nis a way of describing all reality, including the cosmos, as the outcome of\ncreative play by BrahmAn, the intelligent empty space in which the electrons in\nan atom whiz around.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya may be understood\nas the phenomenal universe of perceived duality ( Dvaita Vedanta ) , a lesser\nreality-lens superimposed on the unity of BrahmAn ( Advaita Vedanta )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BrahmAn alone is\nperfect.&nbsp;&nbsp; Everything in creation, being\ndelimited, is imperfect.&nbsp;&nbsp; The very\nbeginning of creation gave rise to the law of duality&nbsp; . Dvaita Vedanta gives us a peek beyond the\nveil of maya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Advaita Vedanta, the\nonly reality is BrahmAn, the Oneness. All else that exists is surface reality\nof the world around us. Beyond this surface reality lies the true Absolute\nReality, and that is BrahmAn. BrahmAn is the only reality of this world and all\nothers have only relative reality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When creation occurs,\nthe universe the essence of which was always within Brahman evolves itself and\nissues out of the Brahman with name and form, this is what is called creation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahman creates the world just as a spider creates it's webs out of itself.\nBrahman itself is untouched by the illusion of Maya, just like a magician is\nnot tricked by his own magic. .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SAMKHYA VEDANTA IS\nA&nbsp; TEMPLATE&nbsp; TO EXPLAIN MAYA\u2019S VEIL ON COSMIC ENERGY<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samkhya is a theory of\nevolution and understanding the universe.&nbsp;\nThe dancing girl Prakriti dances as long as the male observer\nPurusha&nbsp; is there. The moment the\nobserver ceases to look at her and understands the dance perfectly, she fails\nto amuse him anymore.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purusha, was never\nreally in bondage, or enmeshed with Prakriti.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nPrakriti cannot be perceived, not because of its non-existence, but\nbecause of its subtlety. It is perceived in its effects. Purusha is neither\nproduced nor does it produce.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prakriti&nbsp; is not produced but it produces. Purusha\nsymbolizes consciousness, the masculine principle. Pragati symbolizes the\nfeminine principle, the activating energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purusha is the sentient\nbeing (consciousness), the experiencer. Prakriti \u2013 primal nature (root of all\ninsentient matter).&nbsp;&nbsp; Purusha is the\nembodiment of pure consciousness, and Pragati as the embodiment of pure energy.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through uniting with\nPurusha , Pragati gave form to his spirit and created the universe.(we are\ntalking about CREATION OF THE COSMOS here- not street side sex&nbsp; as figured out by small minds)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The eternal and indestructible union between\nPurusha and Prakriti&nbsp; gives birth to the\nwhole Macrocosm, in its stable, static aspect as well as in its dynamic one.\nNot only is Shakti responsible for creation, it is also the agent of all\nchange. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Sanatana Dharma\nPurusha&nbsp; is represented by Shiva and\nPrakriti , his wife Shakti ( Parvati )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti is manifested by\nShiva only during creation and is withdrawn into himself at the end of\ncreation. This is for the perceptive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern science repeats\nfrom our Vedas that matter and energy are interchangeable.&nbsp; So does consciousness and energy .&nbsp; In the highest planes they are\ninterchangeable, which is why we see a great incongruence between our spiritual\nexperiences and the external reality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the higher\nmetaphysical realms and subtle planes of our consciousness the physical laws of\nour universe lose their validity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya conceals from us\nBrahman, the fundamental oneness of everything and everyone in the universe.\nMaya hides the true nature of God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term MAYA&nbsp; is mentioned&nbsp;\n72 times in Rigveda written down in Sanskrit in 5000 BC.&nbsp; Maya is mentioned&nbsp; 29 times in the Atharva Veda.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahman is the great\nmagician who transforms himself into the world and then performs this feat with\nhis \"magic creative power\", which is the original meaning of maya in\nthe Rig Veda.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From the might, or\npower, of the divine actor and magician, it came to signify the psychological\nstate of anybody under the spell of the magic play. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As long as we confuse\nthe myriad forms of the divine lila with reality, without perceiving the unity\nof Brahman underlying all these forms, we are under the spell of maya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Hindu view of\nnature, then, all forms are relative, fluid and ever-changing maya, conjured up\nby the great magician of the divine play. The world of maya changes\ncontinuously, because the divine lila is a rhythmic, dynamic play.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maya, or\n\"illusion\", is an important idea in the Upanishads, because the texts\nassert that in the human pursuit of blissful and liberating Self-knowledge, it\nis Maya which obscures, confuses and distracts an individual.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hinduism asserts\n\"Atman (Soul, Self) exists\", while Buddhism asserts that there is\n\"no Soul, no Self\".&nbsp;&nbsp; Buddhism\nis FIT for people like BR Ambedkar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads contain\nfour sentences, the Mah\u0101v\u0101kyas (Great Sayings), which were used by Adi&nbsp; Shankaracharya 4000 years ago&nbsp; to establish the identity of Atman and\nBrahman as scriptural truth:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Praj\u00f1\u0101nam\nbrahma\" - \"Consciousness is Brahman\" (Aitareya Upanishad)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Aham\nbrahm\u0101smi\" - \"I am Brahman\" (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Tat tvam\nasi\" - \"That Thou art\" (Chandogya Upanishad)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Ayam\u0101tm\u0101\nbrahma\" - \"This Atman is Brahman\" (Mandukya Upanishad)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dvaita Vedanta school\nwas NOT founded by Rothchild\u2019s FAKE and backdated creation&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhvacharya of the\nFAKE Udipi Mutt. Nobody heard of Madhavacharya before the white Invader came to\nIndia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/01/my-visit-to-sringeri-mutt-exhuming.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/01/my-visit-to-sringeri-mutt-exhuming.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The third school of\nVedanta is the Vishishtadvaita, which was founded by Ramanuja.&nbsp;&nbsp; Rotshchild created Ramanuja strenuously\nrefuted Shankara's works.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ramanuja, just as\nMadhva claims for Dvaita sub-school, states that Vishishtadvaita is grounded in\nthe Upanishads- which is BULL<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dozens sof scholars,\nlike E.J. West, have written that ancient Greek philosophy is\nlifted from Vedanta and that Pythagoras and Plato studied in India\u2014their\nknowledge was half baked.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-decoration: none;\">July 7, 2016 at 1:59 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_158MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCaptainji,<br />\n<br />\nPlease explain makiryam , punartham njattuvelas.<br />\n<br />\nThank you.</div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_158BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_157T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_157TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_158b+seedIyh7D\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_157TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_157TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_158b+seedIyh7D\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_157TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_157TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_157TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_158b+seedIyh7D\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_157B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1307416712194290231\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_157M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_4.html?showComment=1467905396814#c1307416712194290231\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 7, 2016 at 8:59 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_157MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi ar,<br />\n<br />\nWHEN VASCO DA GAMA CAME TO CALICUT IN 1498, HIS SOLDIERS STARTED STEALING PEPPER VINES AND SOIL AT NIGHT.<br />\n<br />\nTHE KING ZAMORIN WAS INFORMED BY SPIES<br />\n<br />\nHE LAUGHED LOUDLY AND SAID-- \"<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THE PORTUGUESE CANT STEAL OUR THIRUVATHIRA NJATTUVELA</span></b>\"<br />\n<br />\nwe have 27 njattuvelas based on sun-- each 14 days. 365 days of the year are divided into groups of fourteen days called Njattuvela, each one bearing the name of a star.<br />\nWhen Sun transits through a star, it is called that star's Njattuvela. There are 2 Njattuvelas in one month.<br />\n<br />\nThe rain which extends from the 15th edavam to 15th kanni is termed as the south-west monsoon or kaalavarsham. About 60% of the rain is by means of south-west monsoon.<br />\n<br />\nSW monsoons start from first June.<br />\n<br />\nThey are south-west monsoon, north-east monsoon and edavapathi<br />\n<br />\nAbout 10% of rain is from the mid rain or eda mazha. It is also known as summer rain. January and April are the months in which the summer rain falls.<br />\n<br />\n. The south-west monsoon travels in the njattuvela's mainly karthika, rohini, makayiram, thiryvathira, punartham, pooyam and aayiliam. The main characteristic of south-west mansoon is to fall with a few breaks and starts raining. At this time the food substances has a special taste than that of in the normal conditions.<br />\n<br />\nThe rain which is extended from the month of thulam to the half of makayiram is termed as north-east monsoon. About 20% of the rain is achieved in Kerala from this monsoon. It is the only rain which starts from afternoon onwards to the night. Thulavarsham is another name of north-east monsoon<br />\n<br />\nOn 21st june Thiruvathira Njattuvela starts and will continue till 4th July. During this 14 days you can plant anything and everything. (paddy re-plantation also happens during this time). Basically you can cut any stem of a plant(provided it is a little matured) and plant it. It will definitely catch up. This is magic.<br />\n<br />\nThe Panchangas list clearly the beginning and the end of Njattuvelas of every month. Like Sun and Moon, other planets too transit through stars. These are given as Grahapakarchas in the Panchanga. Thiruvathira Njattuvela, the best time to plant any kind of seedlings, is on till July 5. Farmers need not follow any already-set farm methods in this season, which commenced on June 22, as it is known as the flourishing period of crops.<br />\n<br />\nThe first Njattuvela called Aswathi Njattuvela starts on Medam 1 or Vishu day.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/04/vishu-new-year-festival-of-kerala-capt.html<br />\n<br />\nthe qutab minar has 27 sections on its circumference. the stonehenge has 27 pillars<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_158b+seedIyh7D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_158b+seedIyh7D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-w1vPRKKL5T8/V352ipf_htI/AAAAAAABK14/n8ESbMmhGUgf10AM3kFpDahVaSHmFUkgwCLcB/s1600/MalayDDalam_naalukal.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"458\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-w1vPRKKL5T8/V352ipf_htI/AAAAAAABK14/n8ESbMmhGUgf10AM3kFpDahVaSHmFUkgwCLcB/s640/MalayDDalam_naalukal.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; Ajit Vadakayil<br />\nJuly 7, 2016 at 9:20 PM<br />\n<br />\nhi sh,<br />\n<br />\nKAMAKHYA TEMPLE WAS DENIGRATED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD WITH ANIMAL AND HUMAN SACRIFICE<br />\n<br />\nNARENDRA DAMODARDAS MODI WENT THERE TO MILK ASSAM VOTES --AND HE SUCCEEDED.<br />\n<br />\nTHERE IS A RUMOUR THAT HE SACRIFICED AN ANIMAL THERE ( I CANT VOUCH FOR IT )<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">AFTER THE FIRST MENSES GIRLS WERE MARRIED OFF TO HANUMAN AND THEN TAKEN TO WHOREHOUSES WHICH CATERED ONLY TO WHITE BRITISH TROOPS.</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">THESE GIRLS WERE GIVEN HANUMAN CHALISA TO RECITE WHEN IN EXTREME AGONY--THEY WERE UNPAID .</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/02/devadasi-system-immoral-lie-of-temple.html</span><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Someone who read my\nposts on CHANGE, asked me how I could pack such terrific punch into two small\nposts, which can never ever be surpassed . &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I said&nbsp; -- Our ancient 7000 year old Vedanta deals\nwith CHANGE in its entirety - by wisdom alone . &nbsp;&nbsp;This is why the white man says that he can find\nlife\u2019s answers only in India.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My blog posts below on\nCHANGE are &nbsp;for EXTREME SHALLOW MINDS.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/change-management-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/change-management-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/04/domino-effect-in-change-management-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/04/domino-effect-in-change-management-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta says very\nsubtly&nbsp; &nbsp;\u201c The objective world / maya is not set up to\nfulfil you. It\u2019s set up to frustrate and break you until you wake up to the\ntrue nature of your Self; until you realise that the subjective reality \u2014 that\nwhich is You \u2014 transcends the objective\u201d<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sanskrit mantras of\nUpanishads are an exuberant outpouring of the spirit of man in respect of\nsomething which is not adequately recognisable to sense perception or even to\nmental cognition, but which summons the spirit of man in a mysterious way.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We get the feeling that\n&nbsp;there must be something above this world\nand this is what our Maharishis penned down.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No SRUTI is like a\nZionist multinational company manual or like the FAKE Astavakra Gita \u2013DO THIS \u2014\nDON\u2019T DO THAT .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta tells us CHANGE\nIS THE ONLY CONSTANT.&nbsp; &nbsp;Everything seems to be transitory, moving, and\nin a state of flux. &nbsp;&nbsp;There is change in\nnature, change in human history, change in our own mental and biological\nconstitution, change in even the solar system, the astronomical setup of things.\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everything is changing.&nbsp; &nbsp;Dvaita\nVedanta shows us the dance between two opposite forces controlled by a mediator\n.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How do we know that\nthings are changing, that things are moving or are transitory? There is a\nlogical peculiarity, a significance and a subtlety at the back of this ability\non our part to perceive change and transition in things. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A thing that changes\ncannot perceive change by itself. Change cannot know change. Only that which\ndoes not change can know that there is change.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a very\nimportant point at the rock bottom of our thinking that we have to recognise.\nIf everything is changing, who is it that is telling us that everything is\nchanging? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Are we also changing\nwith the things that change? If that is the case, how do we come to know that\nall things are changing? Logical analysis of this peculiar analytical\ncircumstance tells us that there is something in us which does not change;\notherwise, we would not know that things are changing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The soul is immortal,\nyet it has subtle change in samaskaras with every re-birth.&nbsp; &nbsp;BrahmAn is the only thing that does NOT change\n. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yet brahmAn is on a\nlearning curve\u2014it soaks in the information every EVOLVED soul gives back when\nit merges with the mother field in the 7th astral layer ( moksha )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The entire creation,\nmay be said to be involved basically, at the root, in a base template of\nbrahmAn </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">which cannot be said to change..\nAncient maharishis, recognised a divinity in all things. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a god behind every phenomenon, which\nis another way of saying there is an imperishable background behind every\nperishable phenomenon.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sun rising and\nsetting, water evaporating and condensing , seasons changing \u2013 the Dvaita\ntemplate and the Samkhya templates&nbsp;\ncauses change everywhere, even in the vast universe of astronomical\ncalculation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads are the\noutpourings of spiritual seekers, sages and maharishis of spiritual perfection\n\u2013 felt the presence everywhere of something that does not change. All things\nseem to be embedded with something that cannot change. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is due to a\nlogical conclusion to which we are led \u2013 namely, that the perception of change\nwould not be possible if everything, including oneself, including even the\nperceiver of change, also changes. Therefore, transitoriness implies a\nnon-transitory background of things.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reality of things\nis what we are after; unrealities do not attract us. That which perpetually\nchanges and escapes the grasp of our comprehension cannot be considered as real\nbecause of the fact of its passing constantly into something else. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we say that things\nare changing, we actually mean that one condition is passing into something\nelse; one situation gives way to another situation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All Hindu gods except\nVishnu earthly mortal avatars ( Rama/ Krishna / Ayyappa/ Parashurama ) are\ncosmic forces. &nbsp;None of them interfered with\nthe LAWS OF KARMA \u2013they subjected themselves to it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Movement is always in\nsome direction, and there is no movement without a purpose. So there must be a\npurpose in the movement of nature, in even the historical transformations that\ntake place in human society and in the world as a whole.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we read the Vedas,\nwe will find that every mantra, every verse, is a prayer to some divinity\nabove, designated by various names: Indra, Mitra, Varuna, Agni, etc. &nbsp;&nbsp;We may give them any other name, according to\nour own language, style or cultural background.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The point is not what\nname we give, but that there is something behind visible phenomena. Our heart\nthrobs in a state of satisfaction of the fact that there is something above us.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Religion, spirituality or philosophy, in the true sense of the term, is the\nrecognition of something above oneself and a simultaneous recognition of the\nfinitude of one's personality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Infinite is\nmasquerading in us, which is another way of saying that the Unchanging is\npresent in us. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Infinite is summoning\nevery finite individual. The Unchanging is calling us moment to moment:\n\"Don't sleep, get up!\" &nbsp; &nbsp;One of\nthe passages of the Katha Upanishad is uttisthata jagrata prapya varan\nnibodhata (Katha 1.3.14): \"Wake up. Sleeping mankind, stand up!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Somebody asked me \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Why is the ninth avatar\nof Vishnu , Lord Ayyappa missing from Kerala \u2013</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>why did Jew Rothschild try to LIE\nand insert Buddha a mere mortal who struggled for salvation instead?<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">All 108 idols ( murtis\n) installed by Lord Parashurama , were made of PANCHA LOHA \u2013of which meteroric\niron and, Irridium formed a small percentage.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The ORIGINAL panchaloha\nidol of Lord Ayyappa in Sabarimala has been stolen by the white invader and so\nhas all the original panchloha idols in 108 Kerala temples . <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6HJN3TC0weU/V4Jbi1xedjI/AAAAAAABK5k/wyq2RimLjREu9o299zzseFU6Mrrwk1gLgCLcB/s1600/imxages%2B%25286%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6HJN3TC0weU/V4Jbi1xedjI/AAAAAAABK5k/wyq2RimLjREu9o299zzseFU6Mrrwk1gLgCLcB/s400/imxages%2B%25286%2529.jpg\" width=\"299\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">Only the idol of Shakti\n( devi ) at MRIDANGA SAILESHWARI TEMPLE MUZHAKKUNNU KANNUR remains . </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-utV1Sa6NGaY/V4JcHP1KO_I/AAAAAAABK5s/9Kb6TLAcRHcHQz333msWDBw2mHPxwtbGwCLcB/s1600/800px-Mrudhanga_Shyleswari_KsheWthram_%25283%2529.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
