, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some FAKE scholars have\nanalyzed similarities between Hindu Upanishads and BULLSHIT Buddhist literature\nto establish chronology for the Upanishads.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The LYING white\nhistorian has dated the early Upanishads in the 800 to 300 BCE range<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedas and\nUpanishads were written down on the banks of the mighty river Saraswati.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">The river Saraswati is mentioned in Rig Veda\nmore than 50 times.&nbsp; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kYwVyp1NvyA/V3n8QxixJ8I/AAAAAAABKzY/9Oiuq1dsAlUdKrgXQdlFMltswNR1x0-KwCLcB/s1600/Haryana-saraswatDDi-river.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"434\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-kYwVyp1NvyA/V3n8QxixJ8I/AAAAAAABKzY/9Oiuq1dsAlUdKrgXQdlFMltswNR1x0-KwCLcB/s640/Haryana-saraswatDDi-river.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">JNU COMMIE PROFESSORS ARE FUNDED FROM ABROAD TO DECIMATE THE GLORY OF ANCIENT INDIA.</b></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-s9aHGyOTuro/V3n8VQV6lRI/AAAAAAABKzc/QJILUvDxOxYTvSTZBoNGaiHw4a1it7_bQCLcB/s1600/sheFFll.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"354\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-s9aHGyOTuro/V3n8VQV6lRI/AAAAAAABKzc/QJILUvDxOxYTvSTZBoNGaiHw4a1it7_bQCLcB/s640/sheFFll.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">River Saraswati dried\nup in 4000 BC. The brother of Lord Krishna , Balarama did OT wish to\nparticipate in the Mahabharat war and went on a pilgrimage\u2014he describes the\ndying Saraswati river ( mouth at Himalayas blocked by a tectonic shift ) .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He came back just in\ntime to witness the last fight to finish between Bhima and Duryodhana.&nbsp; Duryodhana , his body covered with wounds was\ncooling down in one of the clear isolated pools of the dying Saraswati river\u2014water\nattracted his pain wracked body.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhima falsely accused\nhim of hiding under water in a cowardly manner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Duryodhana!\"\nexclaimed Yudhishthira, \"after destroying family and tribe, would you\nyourself escape death by concealing yourself in this pond? Where is your pride\nnow? Have you no shame? Come up and fight. A kshatriya by birth, do you shrink\nbattle and death?\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stung to the quick by\nthese words, Duryodhana replied with dignity: \"I have not come here,\nDharmaputra, a fugitive for my life. It was not fear that brought me here. I\nstepped into the water to cool the fire that is raging within me. I neither\nfear death nor wish to live, but why should I fight? The earth has now nothing\nleft that I came to fight for! All those who stood by me have been slain. My\ndesire for kingdom is gone. I leave the world to you without a rival. Enjoy it\nin undisputed sovereignty.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Duryodhana gave Bhima the advantage of fighting using Bhima's choicest weapon--the heavy mace .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3p77bBh75AM/V3n0vlmSl1I/AAAAAAABKy4/N7WAFfD2uHIFBEH_TtCdZBXyPv8xeWIcACLcB/s1600/bhima-duryodhana-mahaEEbharat-duel.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"303\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3p77bBh75AM/V3n0vlmSl1I/AAAAAAABKy4/N7WAFfD2uHIFBEH_TtCdZBXyPv8xeWIcACLcB/s400/bhima-duryodhana-mahaEEbharat-duel.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Balarama&nbsp; saw Bhima aiming the deadly blow which broke\nDuryodhana's thighs, and his anger flamed up at this great breach of the rules\nof single combat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Fie upon you all!\nWould any kshatriya hit below the navel?&nbsp;\nThis Bhima has offended the law most disgracefully,\" he exclaimed\nand impatiently going up to his brother Krishna, shouted:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"You can look on\nand tolerate all this. But I cannot bear to see such unclean fighting!\" <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Saying this he advanced\ntowards the offending Bhima with upraised plough. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FAlhkkh1uWg/V3nzvtvn7QI/AAAAAAABKyw/O0fde3eC_NoYV2aZyPokEXOjOdgm5Q0BQCLcB/s1600/27-03-15-05D-43-56-0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FAlhkkh1uWg/V3nzvtvn7QI/AAAAAAABKyw/O0fde3eC_NoYV2aZyPokEXOjOdgm5Q0BQCLcB/s640/27-03-15-05D-43-56-0.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The plough was\nBalarama's weapon on supreme occasions, as the discus was Krishna's. Krishna\nwas alarmed when he saw his elder brother advancing in a passion towards Bhima.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He rushed forward and,\nintercepting him, said: \"The Pandavas are our friends and closest\nrelations. They have been the victims of insufferable wrongs at the hands of\nDuryodhana. When Draupadi was insulted in the Assembly Hall, Bhima vowed: 'I\nwill one day in battle break the two thighs of Duryodhana with this mace and\nkill him.' He proclaimed this solemn oath at that time and everyone has known\nit. It is the duty of a kshatriya to fulfil the vow he has solemnly taken\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>THIS EVENT HAPPENED IN\n4000 BC.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>VEDAS WERE WRITTEN DOWN\nIN 5000 BC ( AFTER 30 MILLINIUMS ON ORAL ROUTE ) &nbsp;WHEN THE RIVER SARASWATI WAS MIGHTY \u2013 &nbsp;NO MENTION OF GANGA WAS TO\nBE FOUND IN ANY OF THE VEDAS.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>EVEN A RETARDED CHILD\nWILL NOT &nbsp;DATE VEDAS / UPANISHADS AFTER 4000 BC.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">ONLY AN IMMORAL LYING WHITE MAN OR HIS DESH\nDROHI SOLD OUT &nbsp;INDIAN AGENT CAN DO THIS.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>The days of India\nbanking upon the LYING white man to know our own history is now over.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c986069352735763415\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_6M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_4.html?showComment=1467615090693#c986069352735763415\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 4, 2016 at 12:21 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_6MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/chennai/Infosys-techies-remark-on-accuseds-appearance-led-to-her-murder/articleshow/53036593.cms<br />\n<br />\nDO NOT GO BEYOND A POINT TO HUMILIATE SOMEONE . .<br />\n<br />\nHINDU TAMILIANS IN SRI LANKA TOOK A LOT OF SHIT FROM THE SRI LANKAN BUDDHISTS.<br />\n<br />\nWHY WAS LTTE BORN ?<br />\n<br />\nTHEY SRI LANKANS LOADED SHIT IN AIRPLANES , PUMPED IT WITH COMPRESSED AIR IN HUGE CYLINDERS AND SPRAYED IT ON TAMIL VILLAGES . .<br />\n<br />\nTHERE WOULD BE A HUMONGOUS PRICE TO PAY FOR THIS DEHUMANISATION . .<br />\n<br />\nNEVER HUMILIATE FOR ENTERTAINMENT . . IT ALWAYS BACKFIRES . .<br />\n<br />\nDRAUPADI HUMILATED A GUEST KING DURYODHANA . . SHE PAID THE PRICE .. EVEN BHISHMA DID NOT SUPPORT HER . .<br />\n<br />\nTHE NEED TO HAVE MORE FACEBOOK FRIENDS FORCED THE MURDERED GIRL SWATI TO INCLUDE STRANGERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX. .<br />\n<br />\nNOBODY HAS THE RIGHT TO HUMILIATE ANOTHER HUMAN .<br />\n<br />\nSWATI COULD HAVE SAID-- I DONT LIKE YOU. THERE IS NO NEED TO GO BEYOND THAT AND CALL HIM UGLY.<br />\n<br />\nTAMILIANS IN SRI LANKA WOULD HAVE TAKEN ANY AMOUNT OF SLAPS OR EVEN VERBAL ABUSE-- SPRAYING SHIT IS NO NO NO.<br />\n<br />\nNEXT TIME TRY SMEARING SHIT ON ANY PERSONS'S FACE--SEE WHAT HAPPENS TO YOU.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Draupadi insulted a\nguest King\u2014and in those days it was NOT done.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Pandava palace at\nIndraprastha was a \"Palace of Illusions\"\u2014built by Maya Danava.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">King Duryodhan was a\nguest for the Rajasuya Yagna.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Duryodhan encountered a\nhall where half of the floor appeared to be a rippled surface of a lake. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The surface of the\nother part of the huge hall appeared solid .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Duryodhan selected the\nsolid part to step on and fell headlong into a water pool.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Draupadi was waiting\nfor Duryodhana to fall in the water along with her maids. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">As soon as he fell all\nthe women laughed in sarcasm- as if on cue .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">A hysterically laughing\nDraupadi joked loudly \"Andhasya Putra Andhaha\" meaning \"a blind\nman's son is blind\".<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Duryodhana\u2019s father was\nblind king Drritarashtra. It was an EXTREME insult .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Duryodhan stepped out\nof the pool and told Draupadi \u201c This sarcastic laugh will cost you dear \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>MUCH LATER DRAUPADI WOULD BE DISROBED \u2013</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Those who kept quiet\nincluded included mighty warriors like Bheeshma, Drona, Ashwatthama and Kripa,\nand all five of Draupadi\u2019s own husbands.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">All of them could have\ntaken on Duryodhana by themselves .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Yudhishthira had staked\nhimself and his 4 brothers in the dice game , lost and now had the status of\nslaves of Duryodhana.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Then he wagered\nDraupadi lost her.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Duryodhana tells a\nservant to bring Draupadi to the hall so that her can order her to go to the\nmaid's quarters. She is no longer a queen and cannot stay in the main palace.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The servant returns\nwith a question to Yuddhistira from Draupadi which goes like this \"Can a\nman who staked and lost himself to be a slave have any right to stake his\nwife?\"<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Duryodhana orders the\nservant to call Draupadi and ask all this personally. Draupadi refuses to come\nto the hall. Duryodhana then sends Dushashana to bring her. Dushashana drags\nDraupadi to the hall by her hair. Bhima tries to attack Dushashana but is\nstopped by levelheaded Yuddhistira.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Draupadi questions Yuddhistira\nand his brothers. She asks then Bhishma, King Dhritharasthra, Drona and Kripa\nto help and protect a helpless woman. She also asks them the question if a\nwoman is a property of the husband.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Draupadi repeatedly\ndemanded to know from Bhishma a man of Dharma - whether she has been won in the\ndice game or not \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">jitam va ajitam va mam\nmanyadhve sarvabhoomipah: \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cwhat do the kings\npresent here consider \u2013 that I have been won, or that I have not been won?\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Bhishma says:<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Uktavanasmi kalyani\ndharmasya parama gatih<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Loke na shakyate jnatum\napi vijnair mahatmabhih\u2026<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Na vivektum cha te\nprashnam imam shaknomi nishchayat<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sookshmatvad gahanatvad\ncha karyasya asya cha gauravat<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201cI have already told\nyou, auspicious one, the path of dharma is subtle indeed. Even great men with\nimmense knowledge find it difficult to comprehend it\u2026 I am not able to arrive\nat a definite conclusion about your question \u2013 because the matter is subtle,\ndeep and of enormous import.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The essence of dharma\nis difficult to comprehend; hidden is the path of dharma. Dharma is too\nsubtle..<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">That is what Bheeshma\nsays.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The four Pandavas\nyounger feel their dharma does not allow them to act against their eldest\nbrother Yuddhistra.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Draupadi, in a last\nditch effort, finally prayed to Krishna.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">When Dushasana started\npulling her saree , initially Draupadi held on with all her strength . Only\nwhen she let go and raised her hands did Krishna help her .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Lord Krishna sees\nDharma from his perspective as a god \u2013he just sees a woman in acute distress.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Though he knows that\nQueen Draupadi as a hostess had insulted King Duryodhana when he fell into the\npool of water . Such is thing was NEVER done .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Draupadi had confessed\nto Yuddhistira that she as a hostess had insulted guest Duryodhana.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">So did Yuddhistira (the\nembodiment of justice and righteousness) do this deliberately \u2013 on a extreme\nmoral ground of divine justice?<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Why did nobody stop\nYuddhistira from staking so high? Except for Vidura no one did.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"Dharma works in\nvery subtle ways\" -- said Bhishma. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<i style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">He was spot on !</span></i><br />\n<i style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>THE WEST WANTS INDIAN BEEF AS THE HUMPED COWS ARE DISEASE FREE.</b></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; text-decoration: none;\">July 5, 2016 at 1:25 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_61MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nhi ap,</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nJEW ROTHSCHILD INSERTED BUDDHA AS THE NINTH AVATAR OF VISHNU AND DELECTED AYYAPPA.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nTHEN HE CREATED AND BACKDATED TWO FAKE CHARACTERS WHO WERE FRIENDS OF AYYAPPA\u2014TO MAKE AYYAPPA A RECENT PHENOMENON.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nONE WAS MUSLIM VAVAR MUNI\u2014AND HINDUS PILGRIMS ARE FOOLED EVEN TODAY TO VISIT THIS VAVAR MOSQUE BEFORE GOING TO SABARMALA</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nTHE OTHER IS A CHRISTIAN VELUTHACHAN \u2013 AND HINDUS PILGRIMS ARE FOOLED EVEN TODAY TO VISIT A CHURCH AT ARTHUNKAL AFTER GOING TO SABARIMALA.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nSABARIMALA NEVER HAS ANY TELUGU BRAHMINS .</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nRAHUL EASHWARS GRANDFATHER IS A TELUGU BRAHMIN ( Kandararu Maheshwararu )</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nTHEY GIVE BULL ABOUT TELUGU BRAHMINS MEETING LORD PARASHURAMA \u2013 &nbsp; NONSENSE !</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nRAHUL EASHWAR IS NOW A DARLING OF BENAMI MEDIA\u2014LIKE ARUN JAITLEY.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nRahul Eashwar did Global Leadership at the London School of Economics\u2014and he is being groomed to be a SICKULAR Hindu leader.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nAPPARENTLY RAHUL EASHWAR WANTS ZIONIST JEW SUPPORT--THIS IS WHY HE IS PRETENDING TO BE A \"SOFT\" SICKULAR , WHEN HINDUISM IS BEING DECIMATED . ..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THE STORY IN THE LINK BELOW OF TELUGU TANTRIS BROUGHT TO KERALA BY PARASHURAMA IS BULLSHIT.&nbsp;</span></b></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://www.ayyappasamaaj.org/apps/blog/show/6195305-sabarimala-thanthri</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\nSTORY: In order to protect and conduct rituals at these temples, from the banks of the holy river Krishna, he brought two brothers who were Tapasvis (ascetic persons who have undergone rigorous rituals of Tapas). &nbsp;This was sometime in the year <b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">301 AD. &nbsp;</span></b> The rights of Thantries were conferred on these two brothers of the families of Thazhamon and Tharananallur. Thazhamon family was given hereditary rights to the the Dharma Sastha temples while the Tharananallur family was given hereditary rights to the other temples. In order to distinguish who has the rights to which temple, the horizontal staff of the Holy Flag Post (Kodimaram) of each temple controlled by the Thazhamon family points to the North, while that of Tharananallur family points to the South.<br />\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nAs to how the names Thazhamon and Taranallur came into being, here is the story:-</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">When Parashuram was escorting these two elected </span><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">pure </span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">brahmins ( </span><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\">TELUGU PURITY-- TEEE HEEEE</span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"> )</span></b>to the new land of Kerala, he came across a river. He thought it an ideal time to test the abilities of the two brahmins. He asked both to cross the river. The first one walked across the water. `Taranam' in Sanskrit means `traverse' or `cross'. Because he traversed the water, he and his successors earned the name of `Tarananallur'. The second brahmin made the waters part and traversed through the river bed. `Thazhamon' means the sand at the bottom. He and his successors earned the name of `Thazhamon`and the title of `Kantar'. Thazhamon Madom thantries were given charge of the Sastha temples while the Tarananallur thantires were assigned to the Devi temples, especially in north Kerala. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upanishads are\ntreatises on BrahmAn-knowledge, that is knowledge of Ultimate Hidden Reality,\nand their presentation of philosophy presumes, \"it is by a strictly\npersonal effort that one can reach the truth\".&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Upanishads,\nknowledge is a means to freedom, and philosophy is the pursuit of wisdom by a\nway of life<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Chandogya Upanishad\nincludes one of the earliest known declaration of Ahimsa (non-violence) as an\nethical precept. Discussion of other ethical premises such as Damah (temperance,\nself-restraint), Satya (truthfulness), D\u0101na (charity), \u0100rjava (non-hypocrisy),\nDaya (compassion) and others are found in the oldest Upanishads and many later\nUpanishads. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Karma doctrine is presented in the Brihadaranyaka\nUpanishad,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5616960269383755982\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_100M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/04730700381968733721\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Hindustani Deshbhakt</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_4.html?showComment=1467728986159#c5616960269383755982\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 5, 2016 at 7:59 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_100MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCapt., What is this bullshit about Paapayoni and Women in Bhagavad Gita 9.32. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads deal\nwith the nature of ultimate reality (brahmAn) and describes the character of\nand path to human liberation (mok\u1e63ha ) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads are\ncommonly referred to as Ved\u0101nta, variously interpreted to mean either the\n\"last chapters, parts of the Veda\" or \"the object, the highest\npurpose of the Veda\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The concepts of Brahman (Ultimate Reality) and\n\u0100tman (Soul ) are central ideas in all the Upanishads, with \"Know your\n\u0100tman\" their thematic focus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads (\nVedanta ) are the foundation of Hindu philosophical thought<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For millinuums Sanskrit\nverses of Upanishads and Vedas were , memorized by each generation and passed\ndown verbally. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE LAST UPANISHAD WAS\nWRITTEN DOWN IN 5000 BC.&nbsp; THE WHITE\nHISTORIAN HAS BEEN LYING THAT SOME UPANISHADS WERE WRITTEN DOWN AFTER THE DEATH\nOF CHRIST ( SIC).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Schopenhauer was deeply\nimpressed by the Upanishads and called it \"the production of the highest\nhuman wisdom\".&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today all know the\ninfluence of the Upanishads in western philosophy. In western philosophy, only\nthose ideas lifted from Vedanta have inherent wisdom &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The original white skinned\nphilosophers thoughts are shallow minded NONSENSE\u2014it is so easy to spot them<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upanishad means\n'setting to rest ignorance by revealing the knowledge of the supreme\nspirit.'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ADI SHAKARACHARYA\nEXISTED 4000 YEARS AGO AND NOT 1200 YEARS AGO AS WRITTEN BY ROTHSCHILDs\nHISTORIANS.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HINDU THOUGHT AFTER ADI\nSHANKARACHARYA IS NOT ACCEPTED AS PART OF SANATANA DHARMA .&nbsp;&nbsp; ADI SHANKARACHARYA IS THE LAST OF THE 12\nSTRAND DNA MAHARISHIS. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Shankaracharya\nexplains in his commentary on the Ka\u1e6dha and Brihadaranyaka Upanishad that the\nword Upanishad means \u0100tmavidy\u0101, that is, \"knowledge of the Self\", or\nBrahmavidy\u0101 \"knowledge of Brahma\". <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; The image of Jagannath is taken to the Rasa mandapa (a temple hall) of the Gundicha Temple where hymns from the Gita Govinda are sung for the last 3 days of his stay in the temple. During the Rasa Lila, the interaction between Jagannath-Krishna and the gopis is enacted through the Gita Govinda verses. In the olden days, Devadasis sang the verses, which are now sung by the temple servitors. Vaishnavas thus consider Gundicha Temple as Vrindavan during Jagannath's stay there.[13] UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nDEVADASIS, RADHA, JAYADEVA ARE ALL FAKE AND BACK DATED CREATIONS OF JEW ROTHSCHILD<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: when Jagannath (identified with the god Krishna) goes to stay for seven days in the Gundicha Temple, he intentionally leaves behind his consort Lakshmi locked up in a store room in the main Jagannath temple. While in the Gundicha temple, he is exclusively taken care by his gopis (cow-herding girls) led by his gopi-lover Radha like Krishna in Vrindavan. The gopis are symbolized by the temple devadasis on this occasion. When Jagannatha returns to his main temple after his amorous dalliance, Lakshmi meets him at the main temple gate and sprinkles some magical powder on him, which makes him forget about his escapade in the Gundicha Temple, and she is immediately reunited with her husband in blissful love.[18] UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: Lakshmi requests him to return home and Jagannath gives his consent by offering her agyan mala (a garland of consent), which the goddess accepts and takes with her while return to the main temple in the evening. Before returning to the temple, to vent her anger at being left out of the vacation, Lakshmi orders one of her attendants to damage a part of Jagannath's chariot, the Nandighosha. This ritual is known as the Ratha Bhanga (the breaking of the chariot).[10][11] This is followed by her hiding behind a tamarind tree outside the Gundicha Temple. After some time, she escapes to her home temple in secrecy, through a separate path way known as Hera Gohri Lane, as she fears the repercussions of her angry act.[10][11]UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/02/devadasi-system-immoral-lie-of-temple.html<br />\n<br />\nLAKSHMI IS A COSMIC ALLEGORY<br />\n<br />\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gundicha_Temple<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br />AT EVERY LITERARY FEST THE DROHI BASTARDS COOK UP MORE AND MORE IMMORAL STORIES-- &nbsp; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The performance of all\nthe sacrifices ( only HUMPED VEDIC COW ghee is sacrificed ) , described in the\nMaitrayana-Brahmana, is to lead up in the end to a knowledge of Brahman, to\nprepare a man for meditation. Therefore, let such man, after he has laid those\nfires, &nbsp;meditate on the Self, to become complete\nand perfect.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Agnihotra was part of a\nBrahmins life\u2014he has to do it to format his brain ( nitric oxide ) for memorizing\nhumongous amount of SRUTI verses .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/nitric-oxide-in-agnihotra-yoga-ayurveda.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/10/nitric-oxide-in-agnihotra-yoga-ayurveda.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kaushitaki\nUpanishad says that &nbsp;\"external\nrituals such as Agnihotram offered in the morning and in the evening, must be\nreplaced with inner Agnihotram, the ritual of introspection immediately afterwards\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two words that are of\nparamount importance in grasping the Upanishads are Brahman and Atman. The\nBrahman ( morphogenetic field ) is the ultimate reality and the Atman (soul\n)&nbsp; is individual self.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahman comes from the\nroot brh, which means \"The Biggest - The Greatest - The ALL.\"&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Brahman is \"the infinite Spirit\nSource and fabric and core and destiny of all existence, both manifested and\nunmanifested and the formless infinite substratum and from whom the universe\nhas grown\". <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahman is the\nultimate, both transcendent and immanent, the absolute infinite existence, the\nsum total of all that ever is, was, or shall be. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word Atman means\nthe immortal perfect Spirit of any LININGg creature, all beings, including\nanimals and trees. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0100tman is a central idea\nin all the Upanishads, and \"Know your \u0100tman\" their thematic focus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These 7000 year old&nbsp; texts state that the inmost core of every\nperson is not the body, nor the mind, nor the ego, but Atman \u2013 \"Soul\"\nor \"Self\". Atman is the spiritual essence in all creatures, their\nreal innermost essential being. It is eternal, it is the essence, it is ageless.\nAtman is that which one is at the deepest level of one's existence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ON MOKSHA , SOUL MERGES\nBACK WITH THE MOTHER FIELD \u2013WHICH IT HAS LEFT LONG AGO, TO EXPERIENCE EVERY\nFORM OF LIFE ON EARTH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN A HUMAN IS\nLIBERATED , BY BURNING HIS EGO ( JIVAN MULKT ) , HIS SOUL IS NOW BRAHMAN WHILE\nHE IS ON EARTH INSIDE A HUMAN MORTAL COIL.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN SANATANA DHARMA WE DO NOT CREMATE SUCH PEOPLE\u2014WE BURY THEM IN A YOGIC\nMEDITATIVE POSE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE WHITE MAN WITH\nSHALLOW MIND WROTE-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : <i>Atman is the\npredominantly discussed topic in the Upanishads, but they express two distinct,\nsomewhat divergent themes. Some state that Brahman (Highest Reality, Universal\nPrinciple, Being-Consciousness-Bliss) is identical with Atman, while others\nstate Atman is part of Brahman but not identical. This ancient debate flowered\ninto various dual, non-dual theories in Hinduism. </i>UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0950</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u093e\u0928\u094d\u0924\u093f\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u093e\u0928\u094d\u0924\u093f\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u093e\u0928\u094d\u0924\u093f\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om\nasato mA sadgamaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tamaso\nmA jyotirgamaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mrityorma\namritam gamaya,<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om\nshanti, shanti, shanti.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om, lead me from unreal\n(delusion /transitory material existence) to the real ( truth/ Eternal Self),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From darkness (of\nignorance) to light (of wisdom, truth, spiritual knowledge),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From the fear of death\nto the knowledge of immortality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Om Peace, peace, peace!</span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We chanted SHANTI three\ntimes in the end<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pray?.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our ancient scriptures\ntell us that one of the main objectives of life is to remove three kinds of\nobstacles or to eliminate three kinds of suffering.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Samkhya system\nof philosophy (Samkhya Pravachana Sutram), the very first sutra states:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Permanent and\ncomplete elimination of the three-fold suffering is the supreme purpose of\nlife\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0925</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u094d\u0930\u093f\u0935\u093f\u0927\u0926\u0941\u0903\u0916\u093e\u0924\u094d\u092f\u0928\u094d\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u093f\u0935\u0943\u0924\u094d\u0924\u093f\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0924\u094d\u092f\u0928\u094d\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0941\u0930\u0941\u0937\u093e\u0930\u094d\u0925\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"\n(1.1)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Atha\ntrividhadukhantyanta nivrittiH atyanta purusharthaH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even though the\nthree-fold suffering is not explicitly defined in the sutra, every commentator\ntakes it to mean the following three forms of suffering &nbsp;( KLESHA ):<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adhidaivika (of divine\norigin)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adhibhautika\n(originated in the physical, material beings)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adhyatmika (created by\nourselves)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Adhidaivika</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word\n\"daivika\" means \"of divine origin\". Adhidaivika refers to\nthe suffering due to divine causes, causes that we have no control over. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Adhibhautika</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word \u2018bhautika\u2019 is\nderived from \u2018bhuta\u2019 which means all beings. It can also mean any entity,\nliving or non-living. For example, even a stone can be termed a bhuta. So\nAdhibhautika refers to suffering caused by other beings. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adhyatmika</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word \u2018atmika\u2019 means\n\u2018self-inflicted\u2019. Adhyatmika suffering is the most damaging and long-lasting\nsuffering as we inflict it on ourselves. This could be physical, mental, or\nemotional suffering. Most of the suffering is caused by the mind due to EGO .\nWe suffer when we carry negative emotions \u2013 anger, hatred, jealousy, greed etc.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/aIxEuyEg70k/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/aIxEuyEg70k?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali, in the Yoga\nSutras, provides an excellent explanation of the suffering, its causes and the\nremedy. He describes five kinds of kleshas (sufferings) which are all caused by\nour ignorance of not knowing our true identity. We suffer because we allow our\nnegative ego (ahamkara) to take over our intellectual capabilities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali also tells us\nthat suffering that has not yet come can and must be avoided&nbsp; \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0939\u0947\u092f\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0926\u0941\u0903\u0916\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0928\u093e\u0917\u0924\u092e\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\u2013 heyam duhkham anagatam (sutra 2.16). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali, in\nsubsequent sutras, goes on to explain that the suffering is caused by ignorance\nand it is up to us to eliminate this ignorance through the practice of the\neight limbs of yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, the reason we\nrecite the word \u2018shanti\u2019 three times at the end of the class or any ritualistic\nprayer is to pray for peace in the face of all the three sources of suffering\ndescribed above.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When I went for my school\nreunion we had an school assembly all over again.&nbsp;&nbsp; None of us forgot the school morning prayer\n. It was a liberating experience<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Google <b><span style=\"color: red;\">OLD ALUMNI MEET</span></b> \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What do you see on page\n1 --&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; as item 1--&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;among\n1.5 million posts ?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
