font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>The vitamin folic acid\n(or folate) is important for brain and spinal cord development.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/10/sesame-seed-sweat-of-lord-vishnu-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/10/sesame-seed-sweat-of-lord-vishnu-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SINCE I AM BUSY, WATCH\nTHE PICTURES AND VIDEO FIRST<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/6Ii_v3t9hpU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/6Ii_v3t9hpU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ouMi5z1vwbE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ouMi5z1vwbE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-u2c9XPi_VC0/V3YzADYxgdI/AAAAAAABKok/ccSwb2Shxa8Vbp3PNvsb-4IM3QncCHDjQCLcB/s1600/screen_shot_2015-03-23_affft_100107_am-14C4727D1FD1491954C.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"342\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-u2c9XPi_VC0/V3YzADYxgdI/AAAAAAABKok/ccSwb2Shxa8Vbp3PNvsb-4IM3QncCHDjQCLcB/s640/screen_shot_2015-03-23_affft_100107_am-14C4727D1FD1491954C.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-g4_5mwP9gVQ/V3YzHApAUVI/AAAAAAABKoo/kBAjxnVQoaclKgDwg9gF-tuxzumfL8c3gCLcB/s1600/imccvbages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"274\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-g4_5mwP9gVQ/V3YzHApAUVI/AAAAAAABKoo/kBAjxnVQoaclKgDwg9gF-tuxzumfL8c3gCLcB/s400/imccvbages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Myelomeningocele&nbsp; is a severe form of spina bifida. The spinal\ncord and nerves develop outside the baby\u2019s body. This results in weakness and\nloss of sensation below the defect. It can interfere with bowel or bladder function\nor cause fluid to build up in the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Myelomeningocele is a\nbirth defect in which the backbone and spinal canal do not close before birth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sacral region\n(sacrum) is at the bottom of the spine and lies between the fifth segment of\nthe lumbar spine (L5) and the coccyx (tailbone)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-aCCNAGty9kU/V3Y_KfQAmOI/AAAAAAABKpI/U3-KeoQNfv8oiudvt7MEvZp3DlYnb0aoQCLcB/s1600/spinal_00ap.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-aCCNAGty9kU/V3Y_KfQAmOI/AAAAAAABKpI/U3-KeoQNfv8oiudvt7MEvZp3DlYnb0aoQCLcB/s640/spinal_00ap.jpg\" width=\"343\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normally, during the\nfirst month of a pregnancy, the two sides of the baby's spine (or backbone)\njoin together to cover the spinal cord, spinal nerves and meninges (the tissues\ncovering the spinal cord).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The developing brain and spine at this point are\ncalled the neural tube. Spina bifida refers to any birth defect involving\nincomplete closure of the neural tube in the area of the spine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Myelomeningocele is a\nneural tube defect in which the bones of the spine do not completely form. This\nresults in an incomplete spinal canal. The spinal cord and meninges (the\ntissues covering the spinal cord) protrude from (stick out of) the child's\nback. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rest of spina\nbifida cases are most commonly:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Spina bifida occulta, a\ncondition in which the bones of the spine do not close but the spinal cord and\nmeninges remain in place and skin usually covers the defect.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Meningoceles, a\ncondition where the tissue covering the spinal cord protrudes from the spinal\ndefect, but the spinal cord remains in place.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Other congenital\ndisorders or birth defects may also be present in a child with\nmyelomeningocele. Hydrocephalus may affect as many as 90% of children with\nmyelomeningocele. Other disorders of the spinal cord or musculoskeletal system\nmay be seen, including syringomyelia (a fluid-filled cyst within the spinal\ncord) and hip dislocation.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A newborn with this\ndisorder will have an open area or a fluid-filled sac on the mid to lower back.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Symptoms may include:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Loss of bladder or\nbowel control<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Partial or complete\nlack of sensation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Partial or complete\nparalysis of the legs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Weakness of the hips,\nlegs, or feet of a newborn<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other signs and/or\nsymptoms may include:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Abnormal feet or legs,\nsuch as clubfoot</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Buildup of fluid inside\nthe skull (hydrocephalus)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-YqEesUFebNs/V3ZAhl3aAGI/AAAAAAABKpY/IV_kfr-wgm4J0YgSnb2PMSytHGSmiGfQACLcB/s1600/db44db14c388200ba92065f5dd232b61a0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"318\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-YqEesUFebNs/V3ZAhl3aAGI/AAAAAAABKpY/IV_kfr-wgm4J0YgSnb2PMSytHGSmiGfQACLcB/s400/db44db14c388200ba92065f5dd232b61a0.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prenatal screening can\nhelp diagnose this condition. During the second trimester, pregnant women can\nhave a blood test called the quadruple screen. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This test screens for\nmyelomeningocele, Down syndrome, and other congenital diseases in the baby. Most\nwomen carrying a baby with spina bifida will have a higher-than-normal level of\na protein called maternal alpha fetoprotein (AFP).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MSAFP is a screening\ntest that examines the level of alpha-fetoprotein in the mother\u2019s blood during\npregnancy. This is not a diagnostic test Blood is drawn from veins in the\nmother\u2019s arm and sent off to a laboratory for analysis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MSAFP IS most accurate\nduring the 16th to 18th week.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All pregnant women\nshould be offered the MSAFP screening, but it is especially recommended for:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women who have a family\nhistory of birth defects<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women who are 35 years\nor older<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women who used possible\nharmful medications or drugs during pregnancy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women who have diabetes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alpha- fetoprotein(AFP)\nis found in both fetal serum and also amniotic fluid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This protein is\nproduced early in gestation by the fetal yolk sac and then later in the liver\nand gastrointestinal tract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High levels of AFP may\nsuggest the developing baby has a neural tube defect such as spina bifida or\nanencephaly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High levels of AFP may\nalso suggest defects with the esophagus or a failure of your baby\u2019s abdomen to\nclose.However, the most common reason for elevated AFP levels is inaccurate\ndating of the pregnancy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Low levels of AFP and\nabnormal levels of hCG and estriol may indicate the developing baby has Trisomy\n21( Down syndrome), Trisomy 18 (Edwards Syndrome) or another type of chromosome\nabnormality.</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AFP is a protein\nnormally made by a developing fetus, so it is naturally present in maternal\nserum and called MSAFP. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a fetus has spina\nbifida, the levels of MS-AFP may be higher than usual because it leaks out of\nthe hole in the spine. &nbsp; &nbsp; If a woman's AFP screen comes back abnormal with a high\nMS-AFP value, she often is at a higher risk for having a baby with spina\nbifida.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BREACHING OF BLOOD\nBRAIN BARRIER BY NANO CARBON CAN CAUSE MYELOMENINGOCELE.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BEFORE ADVENT OF CNG/ LPG THIS DISEASE WAS\nRARE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OUR COLLEGIUM JUDGES\nARE PUSHING EVEN VILLAGE WOMEN TO USE LPG CYLINDERS AND PM MODI WANTS TO IMPORT\nUS SHALE GAS FROM HALF WAY AROUND THE PLANET\u2014</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE KNOW WHY !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The BBB is a very\nselective physical filter within the capillaries that carry blood to the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/palmistry-and-simian-lines-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/palmistry-and-simian-lines-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN INDIA NEURAL TUBE\nDEFECTS ARE RARE DUE TO OUR GOTRA SYSTEM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Neural tube defects are\nbirth defects of the brain, spine, or spinal cord. They happen in the first\nmonth of pregnancy, often before a woman even knows that she is pregnant. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The two most common\nneural tube defects is spina bifida where the fetal spinal column doesn't close\ncompletely.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Folic acid helps the\nbody break down, use, and create new proteins. It helps form red blood cells\nand create new DNA, and prevents against heart disease, Alzheimer\u2019s disease,\ntype-2 diabetes and depression. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most well-known,\nhowever, is the fact that folic acid plays a key role with pregnant women by\npreventing birth and neural tube defects. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As folic acid is water\nsoluble, however, it passes through your body very quickly. By taking folic\nacid every day, you ensure that you always have it in your system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Folic acid from food is\nnot associated with any health risk. As a water-soluble vitamin, any\nsignificant excess will naturally be eliminated through the body via urine,\ntherefore the body is more adept at using folate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Foods known to be high\nin folate include:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Dark leafy greens (\nspinach etc)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Asparagus<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Fortified whole grains\n(pasta, cereal, breads etc)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Beans and legumes\n(nuts, lentils, chickpeas, kidney beans etc)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Chicken liver<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Broccoli<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>lettuce<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Mango<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<i style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Orange</i><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Myelomeningocele can be\nseen after the child is born.&nbsp; A\nneurologic exam may show that the child has loss of nerve-related functions\nbelow the defect.&nbsp;&nbsp; For example, watching\nhow the infant responds to pinpricks at various locations may reveal where the\nbaby can feel the sensations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tests done on the baby\nafter birth may include x-rays, ultrasound, CT, or MRI of the spinal area.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In cases where a severe\ndefect is detected early in the pregnancy, abortion may be considered. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After your baby is\nborn, surgery to repair the defect is most often recommended within the first\nfew days of life.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before surgery, the\ninfant must be handled carefully to reduce damage to the exposed spinal\ncord.&nbsp; This may include special care and\npositioning, protective devices, and changes in the methods of handling,\nfeeding, and bathing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most children will\nrequire lifelong treatment for problems that result from damage to the spinal\ncord and spinal nerves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A myelomeningocele can\nmost often be surgically corrected, but the affected nerves may still not\nfunction normally. (The higher the location of the defect on the baby's back,\nthe more nerves will be affected.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With early treatment,\nlength of life is not severely affected.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nKidney problems due to poor drainage of urine are the most common cause\nof death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because of the risk of\nhydrocephalus and meningitis, more of these children will have learning\nproblems and seizure disorders.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/7qC99THkEaQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/7qC99THkEaQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">New problems within the\nspinal cord can develop later in life, especially after the child begins\ngrowing rapidly during puberty.&nbsp;&nbsp; This\ncan lead to more loss of function as well as orthopedic problems such as\nscoliosis, foot or ankle deformities, dislocated hips, and joint tightness or\ncontractures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Complications of spina\nbifida may include:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Traumatic birth and\ndifficult delivery of the baby<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Frequent urinary tract\ninfections<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Fluid buildup on the\nbrain (hydrocephalus)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Loss of bowel or\nbladder control<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Low blood oxygen level\nin the baby<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Brain infection\n(meningitis)<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Permanent weakness or\nparalysis of legs<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Call your doctor if:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>A sac or open area is\nvisible on the spine of a newborn infant<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The child is late in\nwalking or crawling<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Symptoms of\nhydrocephalus develop, including bulging soft spot, irritability, extreme sleepiness,\nand feeding difficulties</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Symptoms of meningitis\ndevelop, including fever, stiff neck, irritability, and a high-pitched cry</i><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/3VCS4QDETac/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/3VCS4QDETac?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, Spina bifida\nbelongs to a group of disorders known as neural tube defects (NTDs). These all\ninvolve problems in the development and closure of the neural tube, a structure\nin the human fetus that begins forming very early in a pregnancy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The neural\ntube eventually becomes the spinal column. When the neural tube does not close\nproperly, it can lead to spina bifida, a disruption in the spinal column. Spina\nbifida occurs to varying degrees of severity, and in various forms.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spina bifida is also\nknown by the name spinal dysraphism.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It generally occurs in two major types.\nOne types is spina bifida cystica or spina bifida aperta, which involves a sac\nfilled with spinal contents along the spine. The other type is spina bifida\nocculta, in which the spinal cord stays inside the spinal canal and there is no\nsac.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spina bifida ranges\nfrom having no or mild effects, to having severe effects and a significant\nimpact upon a person's life. Physical symptoms can include weakness of limbs,\nparalysis, lack of bowel or bladder control, learning problems, hydrocephalus ,\nseizures , central apnea, club-feet, impaired vision, and latex sensitivity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spina bifida is one of\nthe most common birth defects worldwide. This is a defect in the&nbsp; closure of the vertebral column that may or\nmay not involve the spinal cord or meninges (covering layers of central nervous\nsystem) or both&nbsp; being out-pouched. SB is\ncalled a&nbsp; neural tube defect (NTD).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are three types\nof SB,--</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Spina bifida occulta\n(surface area of some of the vertebrae is not completely closed).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Spina bifida cystica\nwith meningocele (meninges are pushed into the gaps of vertebrae).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<i style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spina bifida cystica\nwith myelomeningocele (meninges and spinal cord protrude through the opening).</i><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Treatment by stem cells\nis a new way of treating the neural tube diseases. Damaged cells of the spinal\ncord in spina bifida do not repair themselves. But, the stem cells have the\nability to divide and to differentiate into cells of the spinal cord. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When stem cells are\nintroduced in a damaged area, they can repair cells of that area. So,\ncomplications due to damaged cells can be minimized.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stem cells can be\nextracted from pre-natal as well as post-natal patients. In pre-natal patients,\nembryonic cells, amniotic mesenchymal stem cells and umbilical cord blood are\ncollected for their stem cells <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a developing baby\ncannot move their limbs well in utero, this sometimes leads to feet and legs\nthat turn inward, or clubfoot.&nbsp; As a\nresult, some children with spina bifida are born with clubfoot. You must have often\nwondered why this happens, right?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/N7-wNsANn8g/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/N7-wNsANn8g?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Myelomeningoceles often\ncause spinal fluid to not flow properly through the system, and hydrocephalus\nmay be a result.&nbsp; Head ultrasound scans\nmay show hydrocephalus in about 90% of newborns with spina bifida. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gKbbVkVzmnM/V3ZHbaRqQtI/AAAAAAABKpo/Qj8PDZ_529IMmyXiUn7fjk1WOimGNke4gCLcB/s1600/normal-hydrocephalus-comgggparison.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-gKbbVkVzmnM/V3ZHbaRqQtI/AAAAAAABKpo/Qj8PDZ_529IMmyXiUn7fjk1WOimGNke4gCLcB/s400/normal-hydrocephalus-comgggparison.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hydrocephalus can\neventually cause increased pressure to develop in the brain. This may\nultimately lead to one's brain not being able to grow properly, and cause\nlearning problems. Seizures may also be present.&nbsp;&nbsp; Children with hydrocephalus have lower IQs\nthan their siblings without the condition.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/7cRiT8FEfok/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/7cRiT8FEfok?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, Hydrocephalus is the\naccumulation of excessive amounts of CSF in the brain.&nbsp;&nbsp; It can affect as many as 90% of children\nwith myelomeningocele.&nbsp; &nbsp; It can raise\nintracranial pressure (ICP) that may prove fatal if not treated on time.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/aiKNjEdVibw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/aiKNjEdVibw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In about 5% of spina\nbifida cases, there is no spinal tissue in the cyst wall; these are called\nmeningoceles. Hydrocephalus is not usually present in this type of spina\nbifida, and a neurological examination may even be perfectly normal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Qmym2iFVNw8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Qmym2iFVNw8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>There is no known cure\nfor spina bifida. </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Treatment primarily\nfocuses on dealing with symptoms as they arise, since they vary so greatly from\nperson to person.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Surgery to correct the\nspinal problem in spina bifida cystica is often done. This involves carefully\ntucking the spinal contents back into the spinal column, and closing the\ncovering back up.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Generally, muscular\nimbalance is present in patients with myelomeningocele, which results in joint\ncontractures and developmental problems, such as hip dislocation and spinal\ndeformities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children with\nmyelomeningocele tend to demonstrate generalized deficits in visual memory and\nauditory/verbal memory. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Approximately 25-35% or\nmore of children with myelomeningocele are born with hydrocephalus, and an\nadditional 60-70% of patients with myelomeningocele develop hydrocephalus after\nclosure of the myelomeningocele lesion.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hydrocephalus can cause\nexpansion of the ventricles and loss of cerebral cortex and is associated with\nan increased risk of cognitive impairment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seizures occur in\n10-30% of affected children and adolescents. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Renal failure is still\nthe leading cause of death in patients with myelomeningocele after the first\nyear of life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In general, infants\nwith spina bifida cystica present with the following:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Lethargy<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Poor feeding<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Irritability<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Stridor<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ocular motor incoordination<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Development delay</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Older children may\npresent with the following:-<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Cognitive or behavioral\nchanges<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Decreased strength<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Increased spasticity<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Changes in bowel or\nbladder function<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Lower cranial nerve\ndysfunction<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Back pain</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Worsening spinal or\nlower extremity orthopedic deformities</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children with\nmyelomeningocele are often short in stature. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meningocele and\nmyelomeningocele must be differentiated. Meningocele is the herniated\nprotrusion of only the meninges through a defect in the cranium or vertebral\ncolumn. This lesion does not contain neural tissue in the sac.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spina bifida occulta is\ncharacterized by simple lack of fusion of vertebral spinous processes. The\nspinal cord itself is normal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children with spina\nbifida often have impairment in fine motor skills and in conducting activities\nof daily living (ADL).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Children with myelomeningocele often\nexperience restricted play and recreational opportunities because of limited\nmobility and physical limitations. This inactivity decreases the potential for\nnormal development in all spheres and can exert a negative impact on\nself-esteem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Spina Bifida\nOcculta&nbsp;&nbsp; is considered to be a mild form\nof the defect. The spinal cord and surrounding structures are still inside the\nbaby, but the bones of the lower back fail to form normally. This leaves a\nhairy patch or dimple over the affected area of the spine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A meningocele is a\nCSF-filled extension of his spinal canal, without any spinal cord or spinal\nnerves in it<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below :</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">&nbsp;KYA AAPKE TOOTHPASTE MEIN NAMAK HAI?</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">KYA AAPKE GAAND KE OOPAR BAAL HAI ?</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_teYI8bXvs8/V3ZLQElFiNI/AAAAAAABKp0/8EfTqJjCmxgN64WpDSE0Ekvl6rpxNobMgCLcB/s1600/Nol.ocpcd-5ToHYlcccZcXsA_m.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"295\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_teYI8bXvs8/V3ZLQElFiNI/AAAAAAABKp0/8EfTqJjCmxgN64WpDSE0Ekvl6rpxNobMgCLcB/s400/Nol.ocpcd-5ToHYlcccZcXsA_m.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Optic atrophy and\nsquinting may occur in people who have spina bifida, and a result of these may\nbe poorer vision.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NF02Vlddqjo/V3ZNbbQxeEI/AAAAAAABKqA/nfFAj2mToggitoA55AM_MD_tUoxW8hk9wCLcB/s1600/Bq9OY8_CQAXXA-U1L.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"494\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NF02Vlddqjo/V3ZNbbQxeEI/AAAAAAABKqA/nfFAj2mToggitoA55AM_MD_tUoxW8hk9wCLcB/s640/Bq9OY8_CQAXXA-U1L.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe width=\"320\" height=\"266\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/K-lp_BN1SjE/0.jpg\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/K-lp_BN1SjE?feature=player_embedded\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">TO BE CONTINUED--</span></b><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Long ago, I was in my\ncompany\u2019s office abroad, conducting an interview of some Europeans Captains who\nwanted a job. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PSSST: &nbsp;<i>I used to do job\ninterviews of European Chief Engineers too. As soon as I introduce myself as a\ndeck boy , they immediately get their tails up. &nbsp;But within 5 minutes they know that their\nentire engineering knowledge I hold under my finger nail\u2014and they get emotional.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So I tell these\nCaptains who want a job in my company\u2014I will pass you with just one single\nquestion .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you answer right, you are IN. If you cant answer, you will take a\nflight back home tonight.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It went further to\ncover every single aspect of ancient Hindu life and human thought. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today when I think that\nBOOLEAN LOGIC was lifted from Rig Veda ( 10.129 ) ( the easier ones explained\nby simple four circles of catuskoti: \"A\", \"not A\", \"A\nand 'not A'\", and \"not A and not not A\")&nbsp; penned down 7000 years ago, after 30\nmilliniums on oral ( sruti ) route my body hairs stand up.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are seven logic\ngates: NOT, AND, OR, NAND, XOR, NOR, XNOR<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-aCgTLoO8aR4/V3DS_Dz2WVI/AAAAAAABKls/6gZjsJTwIr07tjHok1mmDGFoSECN5zRUwCLcB/s1600/Lessoccn1_clip_image12.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/11/sanskrit-digital-language-versus-versus.html?showComment=1437668673597#c4103163019984892000\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">July 23, 2015 at 9:54 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_19MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSree Charan R<br />\nJuly 23, 2015 at 8:10 PM<br />\nRespected Captain,<br />\nRecently, seeing Wikipedia mentioning Indian Scientific Contributions in a more honest( though this is not entirely truthful) manner---<br />\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_logic<br />\nCuriously, it mentions that Charles Babbage(of Computer fame) was influenced by Indian Logic.Can you write more about this?<br />\nThank You<br />\n<br />\nReplyDelete<br />\nReplies<br />\n###############################<br />\nCapt. Ajit Vadakayil<br />\nJuly 23, 2015 at 9:46 PM<br />\nhi scr,<br />\n<br />\nevery single invention of the western man has been stolen from our ancient vedic texts.<br />\n<br />\nAryabhatta ( 2700 BC ) one of the top 5 mathematicians ever , lived in Kerala, as his astronomical calculations used a latitude near Calicut, my hometown. Max Mueller shoved back Aryabhatta by 2500 years.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html<br />\n<br />\nLogic is described by Kerala Namboodiri Chanakya (c. 350-283 BCE) in his Arthashastra.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html<br />\n<br />\nGreeks talk about Pythagoras .Pythagoras was NOT even a mathematician.<br />\n<br />\nHe came to Kerala by ship all the way from Greece 2500 years ago, to cure his debilitating epilepsy .He hung around in the Kerala School of Math , without understanding anything.<br />\n<br />\n- but he had some notes with him and went back as the planet\u2019s No 1 mathematician , thinker and a vegetarian to boot.<br />\n<br />\nPythagoras theorem was too simple for Kerala Mathematicians . They could do the same thing via advanced Calculus and Spherical trigonometry and Algebra.<br />\n<br />\n100 years later Plato would come to Kerala by ship and learn for a few years . And then he went back as a greater cat than Pythagoras\u2014 he was now the planet\u2019s No 1 THINKER !<br />\n<br />\nBoth Pythagoras and Plato had NOTHING original to offer to this planet \u2014 other than what they stole and patented in their own names . Greek Plato ( 427BC-347 BC ) also went back from Kerala as a Mathematician ( he was smarter than Pythogoras ) and a philosopher.<br />\n<br />\nHe shared his spoils with his mentor Socrates, and fellow homosexual side kick Aristotle ( 384 BC- 322 BC ) and got himself immortalized as the founder of the Academy in Athens, the first institution of higher learning in the Western world.<br />\n<br />\nSocrates and Plato were hardcore homosexuals<br />\n<br />\nThis gruesome HOMOSEXUAL TRIO of Plato, Socrates and Aristotle laid the foundations of Western philosophy and science with stolen and patented knowledge .<br />\n<br />\nThe history of fourfold negation, the Catuskoti (Sanskrit), is evident in the logico-epistemological tradition of the 7000 year old Upanishads.<br />\n<br />\nP; that is, being.<br />\nnot P; that is, not being.<br />\nP and not P; that is, being and not being.<br />\nnot (P or not P); that is, neither being nor not being.<br />\n<br />\nThe catu\u1e63ko\u1e6di is a \"four-cornered\" system of argumentation that involves the systematic examination and rejection of each of the 4 possibilities of a proposition,<br />\n<br />\nAll things (dharmas) exist: affirmation of being, negation of nonbeing<br />\nAll things (dharmas) do not exist: affirmation of nonbeing, negation of being<br />\nAll things (dharmas) both exist and do not exist: both affirmation and negation<br />\nAll things (dharmas) neither exist nor do not exist: neither affirmation nor negation<br />\n<br />\nTHERE IS A BIG DIFFERENCE BETWEEN INVENTIONS AND INNOVATION.<br />\n<br />\nNIKOLA TESLA WAS AN INVENTOR<br />\n<br />\nSTEVE JOBS WAS AN INNOVATOR WHO HAD AN ARMY OF BRAINS WORKING UNDER HIM.<br />\n<br />\nMary Everest Boole , the wife of George Boole had written that her husband used the Vedic sutras and the laws of Panini.<br />\n<br />\nSame way Dimitri Mendeleyeev had admitted in writing that his PERIODIC TABLE is lifted from the Sanskrit alphabets of Panini.<br />\n<br />\nGeorge Boole and Augustus De Morgan make their pioneering applications of algebraic ideas to the formulation of logic (such as Algebraic logic and Boolean logic), from the Vedic sutras written down 7000 years ago.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_19BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedC8JD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_17T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedC8JD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_17B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left;
