text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\nBy combining Boolean logic with ancient Vedic mathematics, substantial amount of iteration were eliminated that resulted in 45% reduction in delay and 30% reduction in power compared with the mostly used (Digit Recurrence, Convergence &amp; Series Expansion) architectures<br />\n<br />\nSulba Sutra dictates the rules spelled out in this text require the construction of various shapes of the Vedic fire altars that will occupy the same space. The earlier Vedic Fire altars required five layers of bricks and each layer consisting 200 burnt bricks, and each layers will be in the perfect harmony of each other.<br />\n<br />\nThis may look to be a simple math problem but without using Trigonometry it is hard to construct the rule based fire altars .<br />\n<br />\nSulba Sutra clearly defines the numerology associated with altar by giving examples of simple Pythagorean triples, such as: (3, 4, 5), (5, 12, 13), (8, 15, 17), (7, 24, 25),and (12, 35, 37), as well verbalization of the Pythagorean theorem for the sides of a square without expressing into a mathematical formula. \"The rope which is stretched across the diagonal of a square produces an area double the size of the original square\u201d<br />\n<br />\nPanini\u2019s grammar includes early use of Boolean logic, of the null operator, and of context free grammars, and includes a precursor of the \u201cBackus\u2013Naur\u201d form (used in the description programming languages) .<br />\n<br />\nPanini lived 7500 years ago. The white invader kicked him forward in time as the Big Bang of the bible was only in 4004 BC.<br />\n<br />\nBoolean Algebra served the basis of early transistors and capacitors used in early primitive form of the computer.<br />\n<br />\nRoger Pot Droit-1949 French writer and Philosopher: \"The Greeks Loved So Much Indian Philosophy that Demetrio Galliano had even translated the Bhagavad-Gita. There is not a shadow of the doubt that the Greeks knew all about Indian Philosophy.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nNow let me digress from COW and DHARMA \u2013 to convince the skeptic western mind \u2014NOT that I care. They can all FUCK themselves for all i care.<br />\n<br />\nThere are seven basic logic gates: AND, OR, XOR, NOT, NAND, NOR, and XNOR.<br />\n<br />\nThe AND gate is so named because, if 0 is called \"false\" and 1 is called \"true,\" the gate acts in the same way as the logical \"and\" operator The output is \"true\" when both inputs are \"true.\" Otherwise, the output is \"false.\"<br />\n<br />\nThe OR gate gets its name from the fact that it behaves after the fashion of the logical inclusive \"or.\" The output is \"true\" if either or both of the inputs are \"true.\" If both inputs are \"false,\" then the output is \"false.\"<br />\n<br />\nThe XOR ( exclusive-OR ) gate acts in the same way as the logical \"either/or.\" The output is \"true\" if either, but not both, of the inputs are \"true.\" The output is \"false\" if both inputs are \"false\" or if both inputs are \"true.\" Another way of looking at this circuit is to observe that the output is 1 if the inputs are different, but 0 if the inputs are the same.<br />\n<br />\nA logical inverter , sometimes called a NOT gate to differentiate it from other types of electronic inverter devices, has only one input. It reverses the logic state.<br />\n<br />\nThe NAND gate operates as an AND gate followed by a NOT gate. It acts in the manner of the logical operation \"and\" followed by negation. The output is \"false\" if both inputs are \"true.\" Otherwise, the output is \"true.\"<br />\n<br />\nThe NOR gate is a combination OR gate followed by an inverter. Its output is \"true\" if both inputs are \"false.\" Otherwise, the output is \"false.\"<br />\n<br />\nThe XNOR (exclusive-NOR) gate is a combination XOR gate followed by an inverter. Its output is \"true\" if the inputs are the same, and\"false\" if the inputs are different.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_18B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7251371065291391171\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_18MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nUsing combinations of logic gates, complex operations can be performed. In theory, there is no limit to the number of gates that can be arrayed together in a single device. But in practice, there is a limit to the number of gates that can be packed into a given physical space. Arrays of logic gates are found in digital integrated circuits (ICs).<br />\n<br />\nAs IC technology advances, the required physical volume for each individual logic gate decreases and digital devices of the same or smaller size become capable of performing ever-more-complicated operations at ever-increasing speeds. Urdhava Tiryakbhyam is a Sanskrit word which means vertically defined as urdhavya and crosswise as triyakbhayam in English.<br />\n<br />\nThe method is a general multiplication formula applicable to all cases of multiplication examples. It is based on a novel &amp; rudimentary concept through which all kind of partial products are generated concurrently.<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lVZlMBP658A<br />\n<br />\nPythagoras came to India as a student; but when he left he left as a great teacher. As per Greek history Pythagoras spent 22 years away from home mastering Vedic mathematics, Indian astronomy, Indian music, Hindu mysticism, Yoga, various religious doctrines and philosophy of Yoga<br />\n<br />\nFollowing is a quote from Greek texts-<br />\nQUOTE: Pythagoras became a sworn vegetarian and practiced fasting and Yoga (Standing on one leg).. After his return back, Pythagoras confided to a friend\u201cI am a different man, I am reborn. Through this purification, my center of being has changed. Now truth is not a concept to me, but a life.\" He was 56 years old when he returned home, his home, schools and temples were in ruins due to past Persian invasions. He did not feel welcomed by his friends and neighbors, so he went to southern Italy settling down in city called Crotona and impressed the people over there with his wisdom, so they decided to build an institute which would serve as a school of science, Vedic philosophy and astronomy. There was nothing about the place suggesting any secrecy , since he make sure that the statue of Hermes Trismegistus stood at the inside of the entrance to the school with the words on the pedestal: \"Let no profane enter here.\" He also taught the philosophy, yoga, asceticism, breathing exercise and knowledge of healing through roots and herbs that he had learned from Indians. UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nThe tetralemma is lifted from ancient Indian math.<br />\nIt states that with reference to any a logical proposition X, there are four possibilities:<br />\n<br />\nX (affirmation)<br />\n\\neg X (negation)<br />\nX \\land \\neg X (both) equiv.<br />\n\\neg (X \\lor \\neg X) (neither)<br />\n<br />\nShashi Tharoor talked about weavers and looms at Oxford.<br />\n<br />\nI would have preferred that he was a bit more cerebral than \u201cmundanely melodramatic\u201d.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedC8JD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_19b+seedC8JD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/06/ethos-logos-pathos-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Check out what Adi\nShankaracharya wrote 4000 years ago\u2014\u201c<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">It is impossible that contradictory\nattributes such as being and non-being should at the same time belong to one\nand the same thing; just as observation teaches us that a thing cannot be hot\nand cold at the same moment. The third alternative expressed in the words \u2014\nthey either are such or not such \u2014 results in cognition of indefinite nature,\nwhich is no more a source of true knowledge than doubt is. Thus the means of\nknowledge, the object of knowledge, the knowing subject, and the act of\nknowledge become all alike indefinite. How can his followers act on a doctrine,\nthe matter of which is altogether indeterminate? The result of your efforts is\nperfect knowledge and is not perfect knowledge. Observation shows that, only\nwhen a course of action is known to have a definite result, people set about it\nwithout hesitation. Hence a man who proclaims a doctrine of altogether\nindefinite contents does not deserve to be listened any more than a drunken or\na mad man </span></i>\u201c\u2014\u2009Adi Sankar\u0101c\u0101rya, Brahmasutra, 2.2:33\u201336<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The core areas of Indian\nphilosophy are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Aesthetics \u2013 study of\nthe nature of beauty, art, and taste, and the creation of personal kinds of\ntruth<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Epistemology \u2013 study of\nthe nature and scope of knowledge and belief<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Ethics \u2013 study of the\nright, the good, and the valuable. Includes study of applied ethics<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Logic \u2013 study of good\nreasoning, by examining the validity of arguments and documenting their\nfallacies<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Metaphysics \u2013 study of\nthe state of being and the nature of reality</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN HINDUISM A\nDISCUSSION WAS ALWAYS WIN-WIN.&nbsp; GATES TO\nEACH OTHERS MINDS ARE OPEN.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A DEBATE WAS\nNEVER TO WIN, BUT TO FORGE AN AGREEMENT BASED ON CONSENSUS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anekantavada refers to\nthe principles of pluralism and multiplicity of viewpoints, or vantage points,\nthe notion that reality is perceived differently from diverse points of view,\nand that no single point of view is the complete truth, yet taken together they\ncomprise the complete truth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sanskrit compound an-eka-anta-vada literally\nmeans \"logic gates of uncertainty\" (an- \"not\", ek\u0101nta\n\"certainty\" or \"single-natured\", v\u0101da (\"school of\nthought\" or \"thesis\")<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/95kv5BF2Z9E/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/95kv5BF2Z9E?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Saptibha\u1e45ginaya is the theory\nof seven conditioned predications .&nbsp; Each\nof these seven propositions examines the complex and multifaceted nature of\nreality from a relative point of view of time, space, substance and mode.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To ignore the complexity\nof reality is to commit the fallacy of dogmatism.&nbsp; The phrase \u2018in a way\u2019 (sy\u0101t) declares the\nstandpoint of expression \u2013 affirmation with regard to own substance (dravya),\nplace (k\u1e63etra), time (kala), and being (bhava.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">sy\u0101d-asti-n\u0101sti-avaktavya\u1e25,<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">sy\u0101d-avaktavya\u1e25\u2014&nbsp; in some ways, it is indescribable.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JEW George Boole &nbsp;( died 1864) was an English mathematician,\nphilosopher and logician. &nbsp;He married the\nMary Everest , the&nbsp; niece of Rothschild\u2019s\nagent Colonel Sir George Everest the Surveyor General of India for 14 years .m\n1830 through 1843. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mary Everest Boole\nwrote that her husbands logic was lifted from Indian logic. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; Think what must have been the effect of the\nintense Hinduizing of three such men as Babbage, De Morgan, and George Boole on\nthe mathematical atmosphere of 1830\u201365. What share had it in generating the\nVector Analysis and the mathematics by which investigations in physical science\nare now conducted?--: UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In electronics, a logic\ngate is an idealized or physical device implementing a Boolean function; that\nis, it performs a logical operation on one or more logical inputs, and produces\na single logical output. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Logic gates are\nprimarily implemented using diodes or transistors acting as electronic\nswitches, Logic circuit is one that behaves like a switch, i.e. a two-positive\ndevise with ON or OFF states. This is termed as binary device, in which the ON\nstate is represented by 1 and the OFF state by 0. .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To explicitly define the\nlogic, we use truth tables which express the outputs in terms of all\ncombinations of inputs. A logic gate might sound horribly complex, but it's\nsimply an electric circuit with two inputs and an output.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It receives two\nincoming electric currents, compares them, and sends on a new, outgoing\nelectric current depending on what it finds. &nbsp;&nbsp;A logic gate is a bit like a doorman or\nbouncer who is allowed to let people into a nightclub only if they pass certain\ntests.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are quite a few different types of logic gate, the most common of\nwhich are called AND, OR, NOT, XOR (Exclusive Or), NAND (NOT AND), and NOR (NOT\nOR) seven basic logic gates ease the&nbsp; complexity\nof Boolean algebra and allow for simple application in electronics and circuit analysis.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Truth tables can be used to tell\nwhether a propositional expression is true for all legitimate input values,\nthat is, logically valid. &nbsp; In digital electronics, Boolean logic refers to the\nmanipulation of binary values in which a 1 represents the concept of true and a\n0 represents the concept of false. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\ntype of logic is called Boolean because it was invented in the 19th century by\nGeorge Boole, an English mathematician and philosopher. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He LIED that this amazing clear thinking theory\nis his own. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>George Boole is NO genius--</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>He is an ordinary thief, &nbsp;stole from ancient\nIndia.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just like Albert Einstein or\nIsaac Newton and hundreds like them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Boole died at the age\nof 49 in 1864 &nbsp;. &nbsp;&nbsp;70 years later&nbsp; Claude Shannon recognised the relevance for\nengineering of Boole\u2019s symbolic logic in Computer science . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Last year my elder soon\nwas extolling the virtues of Boolean logic while giving me some jaankari on\ncoding .. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;I asked him \u201c Do you know, it is entirely lifted\nfrom 7000 year old Vedanta\u2014 the shallow white mind cant think so clear &nbsp;\u201d &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Boole\u2019s stolen thinking\nhas become the practical foundation of digital circuit design and the\ntheoretical grounding of the digital age.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suppose you want to\nbuild a security system which only works at night and responds to a door being\nopened. If you have a light sensor you can treat this as giving off a signal\nthat indicates the truth of the statement:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">P = It is daytime.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Clearly Not(P) is true\nwhen it is night-time and we have our first practical use for Boolean logic!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What we really want is\nsomething that works out the truth of the statement:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;R= Burglary in progress<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">from P and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Q = Window open<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A little raw thought\nsoon gives the solution that<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;R = Not(P) And Q<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That is the truth of \u201cBurglary\nin progress\u201d is given by the following truth table:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">P / Q / &nbsp;NOT(P) &nbsp;/&nbsp; &nbsp;NOT(P)AND\nQ</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">F/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; F/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; T/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; F<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">F/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; T/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; T/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; T<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">T/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; F/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; F/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; F<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">T/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; T/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; F/&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; F<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From this you should be\nable to see that the alarm only goes off when it is night-time and a window\nopens.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zyTgMZsK68Y/V3DhZDxOjrI/AAAAAAABKmI/p-WGgMOENFQRjZlNNi1hFoF9YrLmlgOGACLcB/s1600/And_OR_NOT_piddcs.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"406\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zyTgMZsK68Y/V3DhZDxOjrI/AAAAAAABKmI/p-WGgMOENFQRjZlNNi1hFoF9YrLmlgOGACLcB/s640/And_OR_NOT_piddcs.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">AND gate</b> is so\nnamed because, if 0 is called \"false\" and 1 is called\n\"true,\" the gate acts in the same way as the logical \"and\"\noperator. The output is \"true\" when both inputs are \"true.\"\nOtherwise, the output is \"false.\" Suppose we went to a nightclub\nwhere the doorman's job is to enforce a simple rule: \"Everyone in our\ngroup must wear a tie to come in\". We went along with a friend one night.\nIf we're both wearing ties, you'll get in. If only one of we is wearing a tie,\nor if neither of us is, neither of you will get in. An AND logic gate works the\nsame way with two electrical inputs.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The <b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">OR gate</b> gets its\nname from the fact that it behaves after the fashion of the logical inclusive\n\"or.\" The output is \"true\" if either or both of the inputs\nare \"true.\" If both inputs are \"false,\" then the output is\n\"false.\" We're not wearing a tie, so you go to another club further\ndown the street. Here, the person on the door is enforcing a different rule:\n\"A group of people can come in if any one of them is a member\". If\neither we or our friend is a member, or if you both are members, we can both\ncome in. If neither of we is a member, you're both left out in the cold. An OR\nlogic gate works this way with two electrical inputs.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">A logical inverter ,\nsometimes called a<b style=\"background-color: lime;\"> NOT gate</b> to differentiate it from other types of electronic\ninverter devices, has only one input. It reverses the logic state. So far,\nwe've failed to get into either of the clubs. But there's one last hope: you\nknow a friend is having a party a few streets away. The only trouble is,\nthere's a really argumentative and contrary person on the door. He talks to\neach person in turn as they approach him. If you're nice and polite, he shouts\nabuse at you and turns you away. But if you're rude to him, he likes that for\nsome reason and lets you in. In other words, he does exactly the opposite of\nwhat you'd expect! In electronics, there's a logic gate that works in the same,\ncontrary way and it's called a NOT gate or invertor. Unlike AND and OR gates,\nit has only one input and one output.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-BJgPZeXo_Vc/V3DiAz5GQrI/AAAAAAABKmQ/nyM-7ow8mbI8d2Dt-lKpGptUUFUeu2JdACLcB/s1600/logicgatfes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"260\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-BJgPZeXo_Vc/V3DiAz5GQrI/AAAAAAABKmQ/nyM-7ow8mbI8d2Dt-lKpGptUUFUeu2JdACLcB/s640/logicgatfes.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The XOR ( exclusive-OR\n) gate acts in the same way as the logical \"either/or.\" The output is\n\"true\" if either, but not both, of the inputs are \"true.\"\nThe output is \"false\" if both inputs are \"false\" or if both\ninputs are \"true.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The NAND gate operates\nas an AND gate followed by a NOT gate. It acts in the manner of the logical\noperation \"and\" followed by negation. The output is \"false\"\nif both inputs are \"true.\" Otherwise, the output is \"true.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The NOR gate is a\ncombination OR gate followed by an inverter. Its output is \"true\" if\nboth inputs are \"false.\" Otherwise, the output is \"false.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The XNOR\n(exclusive-NOR) gate is a combination XOR gate followed by an inverter. Its\noutput is \"true\" if the inputs are the same, and\"false\" if\nthe inputs are different.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/UCbhu5zaqqY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/UCbhu5zaqqY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electronics circuits to\nperform Boolean logic are commonplace. You can buy integrated circuits that\nperform And, Or and Not and many other combinations of these operations in a\nsingle easy to use package.</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nC<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">omputers contain electronic\ncircuitry that behaves in much the same way as the burglar alarm. In general\nBoolean logic helps when you need to design a circuit that has to give an\noutput only when certain combinations of inputs are present.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Such a circuit is\ncalled \u201ccombinatorial logic\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Boolean logic is\nfundamental to the design of computer hardware &nbsp;and programming.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/IDf2vEcyDfs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/IDf2vEcyDfs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have just started on\nthe glory of Sanatana Dharma. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At sea to make simple\nsailors understand complex theories , I introduced things like FUCK- SHIT- FART\netc.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sailors would immediately\ngrasp it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What is sex? &nbsp;&nbsp;\u2014see- mentally copulate\u2014kiss- pet - hump-\norgasm - pillow talk.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have NOT even reached\nthe 2<sup>nd</sup> stage out of seven..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When pillow talk stage\ncomes\u2014you will see , how the white man sucked vacuumed our ancient achievements\nand patented it in their own names, in a most stealthy and slimy manner. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They said we Indians\nare savages, yet learnt our language Sanskrit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They never expected a\nman named Capt Ajit Vadakayil to come on the scene in the Internet age<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The seven days of the\nweek are lifted from ancient India. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">We\nwere the first to have a solar and lunar calendar. Our sun god in ancient\ntemples rode a chariot pulled by seven horses and the chariots has twelve wheels&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-3d2DvzsgwNk/V3DnXNzp5YI/AAAAAAABKmw/ouX75UcftUY9Q5OB3vzzrF35gUHVe4ZCgCLcB/s1600/531c80d4bf6399cedwer6d242d01dce4980.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"616\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-7JSLUhsXeMY/V3DsGcgX9MI/AAAAAAABKng/plUz4IjbGDgWRNAMIqZzMQw5kD_dQ6FvQCLcB/s640/22a4c2b5dd20.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We have seven astral\nlayers ( sapt loka ). &nbsp;&nbsp;Seventh layer is\nVaikunta<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are seven colours\nin the rainbow and human chakras<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We have seven sapta\nrishis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 7 pure notes\nof Saraswati veena in the diatonic scale.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Saptatantree veena\n(7-string veena) otally, the Veena has 7 strings - 4 main steel ones for\nplaying and 3 steel sympathetic strings.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThe 4 main playing strings are the 4 Vedas. When an expert vainika plays\nthe instrument, one can feel the notes echoing around, radiating around all\ndirections.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sri Yantra defines the\nseven musical scales..&nbsp;&nbsp; Each of the\nseven triangles in the upper half&nbsp; (\nouter) &nbsp;has its counterpart in the lower\nhalf.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per the Mundaka Upanishads,\nwhen a homam is done the right way by a spiritual man ( he must have a wife ) using\nghee AGNI&nbsp; ( fire ) &nbsp;sprouts seven tongues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per the Vedas there\nare seven streams of soma, the drink of the gods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A spiritual sage has 7\nlayers of aura.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are seven types\nof sattvic nature:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Brahma/ respectful,\nsincere, discriminating;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Mahendra/ studios,\ncourageous and learned;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Varuna /attractive,\ntolerant, kind, pleasant;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Yamya/ shows\ninitiative, leadership, timely action;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Kubera/ virtuous,\npatient and diplomatic;<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Gandharva/ wealthy,\ncultivated, enjoys musicand art; and<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Arsa /self- controlled,\nclever with good memory.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Uurdhva Lokas: &nbsp;Bhur loka ; Bhuvar Loka; Svarloka; Maharloka;\nJana Loka; Thapo Loka; Sathya Loka.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seven vital elements;\nelementary substances that forms the means of nourishment and growth of the\nbody are Rasa (fluid); Raktha (blood); Maamsa (flesh); Meda (fat); Asthi\n(bones); Majja (marrow); Sukra (semen).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pradikshana is 7 rounds\nclockwise- circumambulations<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7 is the neutral pH\nvalue between acidity and alkalinity ( tamas / rajas)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 7 periods, or\nhorizontal rows of elements, in the periodic table<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The seven dhatus are\nthe seven tissues of the body-- plasma, blood, muscle, fat, bone, marrow /\nnerve, and reproductive tissue. In Sanskrit, they are rasa, rakta, mamsa,\nmedas, asthi, majja, and shukra respectively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the seven element\ntissues of the body contain their own agni to metabolize the nutrients supplied\nto them through channels of circulation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rasagni in the Rasa\nDhatu or plasma<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Raktagni in the Rakta\nDhatu or blood<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mamsagni in the Mamsa\nDhatu or muslce<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Medagni in the Meda\nDhatu or fat<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Asthyagni in the Asthi\nDhatu or bone<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Majjagni in the Majja\nDhatu or bone-marrow<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shukragni in the Shukra\nDhatu or reproductive fluid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seven is the number of\nexternal holes in the human head: Two eyes, two nostrils, one mouth, two ears<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seven stellar objects\nin the Solar System are visible to the naked eye: The Sun, the Moon and the\nfive classical naked eye planets, namely, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, and\nSaturn. We used only these 7 plus Rahu Ketu nodes on astrology<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3970686505857684692\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_25M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; text-decoration: none;\">June 28, 2016 at 6:27 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_25MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nIT PAINS ME TO MAKE THIS COMMENT--</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nYESTERDAY MORNING MY WIFE CAME RUNNING TO ME SKIPPETY SKIP LIKE A SMALL GIRL-- AND I WONDERED WHY</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nSHE WAS BRIGHT EYED -- SHE CRIED \" ARNAB GOWSAMI WILL INTERVIEW PM MODI TODAY Vedas say that we live in a holographic universe\u2014that our mind is holographic. The hologram has the power to hold and process enormous amounts of data.<br />\n<br />\nIn holography, a three dimensional image of an object is filmed with a laser. The amazing part is that any part of the holographic picture may be used to recreate the whole image.<br />\n<br />\nWhile introducing Nikola Tesla to Akasha or longitudinal field ZPF waves , in 1903, the great Indian mystic has told him -\"Every part is a whole and everything springs from the whole\".<br />\n<br />\nAny image thus recorded can be retrieved simply by illuminating the film with a laser beam possessing the same angle as the original two beams.<br />\n<br />\nOur FREE CHOICE is about finding the right angle to call up the image / memory of what we want or search.<br />\n<br />\nThis is why a person seconds away from suicide can be given a tight slap across his face , to force change this angle-- and then he would not want to commit suicide at all.<br />\n<br />\nAll spacetime events are conscious: they are conscious of other space time events<br />\n<br />\nThis was 45 years before a hologram was invented.<br />\n<br />\nOur brain can store unlimited data, because our brain is holographic.<br />\n<br />\nHolograms are all about changing the angle at which two lasers strike a piece of photographic film- to record many different images on same surface.<br />\n<br />\nThe entire Calculus of Euler\u2019s mentor German Jew Johann Bernoulli was stolen from the Kerala school of math.<br />\n<br />\nJEW Johann Bernoulli and Isaac Newton were MAHAMERUS of their time \u2013thieves both.<br />\nNow imagine\u2014Yogis cleared their sinuses every morning with a copper lota of warm water with a pinch of salt. He drank it through his nose and spat out the mucous extracted water via his mouth.<br />\n<br />\nThe flow of water is the driving force. It sucked the mucous from the capillaries of the sinus -in physics we call EDUCTOR ( venturi principle ) .<br />\n<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8MvHplOIQCI<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHITE MAN HAS NO INVENTIONS AND DISCOVERIES , TILL HE INVADED INDIA\u2013 ALMOST WHATEVER HE DID IS JUST INNOVATION\u2014ON THE BASIC FOUNDATION OF AN INVENTION OR DISCOVERY HE STOLE FROM INDIA AND PATENTED IN HIS NAME.<br />\n<br />\nThe string theory potentially provides a unified description of gravity and particle physics, it is a candidate for a BULLSHIT theory of everything, a self-contained mathematical model that describes all fundamental forces and forms of matter.<br />\n<br />\nIt has been abandoned in favor of quantum chromodynamics.<br />\n<br />\nOnly Sri Yantra contains the TOE.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_55MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_55BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_55B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_56B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3538235732392429569\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_56M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_27.html?showComment=1467197411233#c2208788426874624479\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 29, 2016 at 4:20 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_97MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi a,<br />\n<br />\nA VENN DIAGRAM IS THE BASIS OF VEDANTA.<br />\n<br />\nEVERY DISCUSSION WAS TO FIND COMMON GROUND.<br />\n<br />\nA syllogism ( ANUMANA ) or inference is a logical argument that applies deductive reasoning to arrive at a conclusion based on two or more propositions that are asserted or assumed to be true.<br />\n<br />\nAristotle\u2019s syllogisms are 100% stolen from Vedanta. They were STUPID as Aristotle was a SHALLOW THINKER.<br />\n<br />\nMaharishis could handle multi-term propositions and arguments whereas pea brained THIEF . Aristotle could handle only two-termed subject-predicate propositions and arguments.<br />\n<br />\nAryabhatta ( Aryan Bhattathiripad) was born in Calicut in in 2700 BC- not 550 AD as Wikipedia LIES.<br />\n<br />\nALGEBRA WENT INTO LOGIC 4700 YEARS AGO, WHEN THE WHITE MAN WAS DOING GRUNT GRUNT FOR LANGUAGE !!<br />\n<br />\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aryabhata<br />\n<br />\nGeorge Boole\u2019s calculus is lifted from Kerala school of Math. Boole having a SHALLOW MIND could NOT do justice to the advanced Calculus he stole.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html<br />\n<br />\nBoole baby\u2019s algebra cannot be interpreted by sets under the operations of union, intersection and complement, as is the case with modern revised Boolean algebra-- Theodore Hailperin, gave an interpretation based on a fairly simple construction of rings from the integers to provide an interpretation of Boole's theory.<br />\n<br />\nThe maharishis had a inductive approach to the observation of nature based on experience, which involves experimentation and leads to discovering and building on axioms to create a more general conclusion.<br />\n<br />\nGeorge Boole's lifted wholesale from this method.<br />\n<br />\nIn the Kerala school of math they providing it with mathematical foundations involving equations. We Indians were the first to apply math to thought and logic\u2014which is what theoretical physicists do in modern times . BY doing this the vedic metaphysician expanded the range of applications it could handle \u2014 e.g. from propositions having only two terms to those having arbitrarily many.<br />\n<br />\nThere are 24 valid syllogisms, represented by Venn diagrams<br />\n<br />\nVenn diagrams are generally drawn within a large rectangle that denotes the universe of discourse, the set of all elements under consideration.<br />\n<br />\nIn every discourse, whether of the Maharishis\u2019s mind conversing with its own thoughts, or of his his intercourse with his disciples , there is an assumed or expressed limit within which the subjects of its operation are confined.<br />\n<br />\nInterpretive argumentation is a dialogical process in which participants explore and resolve interpretations often of any medium containing significant ambiguity in meaning. Interpretive argumentation is pertinent to the humanities, hermeneutics, literary theory, linguistics, semantics, pragmatics, semiotics, analytic philosophy and aesthetics.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_97MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_97BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_97B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_98B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3528449774230252697\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_98M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_27.html?showComment=1467197438071#c3528449774230252697\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 29, 2016 at 4:20 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_98MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nTopics in conceptual interpretation include aesthetic, judicial, logical and religious interpretation. Topics in scientific interpretation include scientific modeling.<br />\n<br />\nThe intuitive dialectic is to formulate clearcut rules that, if followed, will yield rational discussion and sound conclusions.<br />\n<br />\nVedic dialectic is an ideal model, and not something one expects to find as an empirical fact. The model can however serve as an important heuristic and critical tool for testing how reality approximates this ideal and point to where discourse goes wrong, that is, when the rules are violated. Any such violation will constitute a fallacy.<br />\n<br />\nA Venn diagram is an illustration of the relationships between and among sets, groups of objects that share something in common.<br />\n<br />\nIf you draw a venn diagram for homosexuals the common thingy is the penchant to molest small underage children.<br />\n<br />\nThe drawing is an example of a Venn diagram that shows the relationship among three overlapping sets X, Y, and Z. The intersection relation is defined as the equivalent of the logic AND.<br />\n<br />\nTin modern times Venns diagrams are used to teach elementary set theory, as well as illustrate simple set relationships in probability, logic, statistics, linguistics and computer science.<br />\n<br />\nJOHN VENNs FATHER ENRY WAS IN KERALA AS AN EVANGELIST\u2014MOST OF THESE EVANGELISTS STUDIED LOCAL LANGUAGES MALAYALAM AND SANSKRIT TO STEAL SCIENCE AND MATH.<br />\n<br />\nJohn Venn developed George Boole's theories in his book \u201c Symbolic Logic \u201c, which later became Venn\u2019s diagrams .<br />\n<br />\nVenn diagrams and Leonhard Euler diagrams were incorporated as part of instruction in set theory as part of the new math movement 6 decades ago<br />\n<br />\nIn mathematical logic, a truth function is a function from a set of truth values to truth values. Classically the domain and range of a truth function are (truth,\u2009falsehood ), but they may have any number of truth values, including an infinity of these.<br />\n<br />\nTruth and falsehood is denoted as 1 and 0 in truth tables<br />\n<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOb_aGxInzU<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_99b+seedJPhqD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_99b+seedJPhqD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html?showComment=1466317097608#c7702207772997801580\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 19, 2016 at 11:48 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_138MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nARYABHATTA NOW GETS \"VADAKAYIL PRIZE\".<br />\n<br />\nAryabhatta of 2700 BC, from my hometown of Calicut was the first to propound the HELIOCENTRIC model of the cosmos, the Siderial day length, and that the earth rotates on its own axis, all the while moving in space -- in writing. Aryabhatta had written that the moon reflects the light from the sun.<br />\n<br />\nFor his his astronomical calculations he used a latitude near Calicut. I am a navigator trained in this subject-- A MASTER NAVIGATOR. For the first 5 years of my command i used SEXTANT .<br />\n<br />\nAryabhatta was the first to calculate Pi of 3.1416 and the solar year of 365.358 days .<br />\n<br />\nHe propounded a heliocentric universe 4000 years before Copernicus, with elliptically orbiting planets and a spherical earth spinning on its axis explaining the motion of the heavens.<br />\n<br />\nHe was the father of plane / spherical Trigonometry and Algebra, when Europe was in the dark ages..<br />\n<br />\nAryabhatta was the first to compute the circumference of the earth, with an error of just 64 mile.<br />\n<br />\nTHE ROTHSCHILD HISTORIAN KICKED ARYABHATTA FORWARD IN TIME BY 3200 YEARS .<br />\n<br />\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aryabhata<br />\n<br />\n##########################<br />\n<br />\nTHE LIST OF MAHA MERUS WHO FOOLED THE WORLD , WHOM I HAVE TRASHED INTO THE GARBAGE BIN OF THE PLANET NOW REACHES 17<br />\n<br />\nGARBAGE BUCKET LIST:<br />\n<br />\n1) BERTRAND RUSSEL<br />\n2) ROMILA THAPAR<br />\n3) IRFAN HABIB<br />\n4) NOAM CHOMSKY<br />\n5) RAMCHANDRA GUHA<br />\n6) SHELDON POLLOCK<br />\n7) SIGMUND FREUD<br />\n8) GEORG WILHELM HEGEL<br />\n9) AMARTYA SEN<br />\n10) WENDY DONIGER<br />\n11) FREIDRICH WILHELM NIETZSCHE<br />\n12) IMMANUEL KANT<br />\n13 ) BARUCH SPINOZA<br />\n14) ALBERT EINSTEIN<br />\n15) ISAAC NEWTON<br />\n16) GUGLEILMO MARCONI<br />\n17) CHARLES DARWIN<br />\n<br />\nNOTE: MENTAL MIDGETS LIKE ROMILA THAPAR , INFAN HABIB , RAMACHANDRA GUHA, SHELDON POLLOCK, WENDY DONIGER MUST BE THANKFUL THAT THEY ARE INCLUDED AMONG A LIST OF CEREBRAL GIANTS<br />\n<br />\n#########################<br />\n<br />\nHERE ARE PEOPLE WHO MADE A DENT IN THE UNIVERSE\u2014THEY GET THE \"VADAKAYIL PRIZE\". font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you have a FRACTAL\nmind Math is connected to the ultimate reality \u2013the golden spiral<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/fractal-mind-of-srinivasa-ramanujan.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/fractal-mind-of-srinivasa-ramanujan.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
