font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedic math was founded\non the metaphysics of Space and Motion (Wave Structure of Matter) .&nbsp; All western philosophers like Bertrand Russell\n,with shallow minds tagged it to the metaphysics of Space and Time (particle\nstructure of matter)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The great power of math\nis that once we develop the exact logical relationships between objects, then\nwe can do away with the objects and simply consider the logical (mathematical)\nrelationship between these things.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Math\nhas a remarkable power which people like Bertrand Russell did not understand.\nCalculus was founded in India for astrology , astronomy and philosophy.&nbsp; We have left behind 7000 year old records and\nnobody can dispute it-unless he is an idiot.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n\n\n\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Math has magic, because\nit did NOT require OBSERVATIONS\u2014mere thinking could figure out everything.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mathematical knowledge\nis certain, exact, and applicable to the real spiralling energy&nbsp; world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Math could supply an\nideal, from which everyday empirical knowledge fell short. All Greek\nphilosophers murdered ancient Vedic philosophy as they were NOT smart enough to\nunderstand even 1% .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They did NOT\nunderstand numbers\u2014then how can they steal and patent without getting caught\nwith their pants down?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Algebra as a branch of\nmathematics is given away to a Persian, al-Khwarizmi, who wrote the earliest\nknown algebra text. (The word \"algebra\" comes from a Persian word in\nthe title, \"al'jabr\", which means \"to restore\". <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BALLS ! </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kerala school of Math\ngave him translated knowledge for gold.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hey THIEF Pythagoras\n\u2014did you ever try Math&nbsp; long division,\nfor example, using Roman numerals? Mathematicians attempted to do algebra in\nthose days but lacked the language of algebra, namely the symbols we take for\ngranted such as +, -, X, \u00f7 and =.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calculus was developed\nout of a need to understand continuously changing quantities, without which you\ncant make progress in Astrology and Philosophy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Differential calculus\nis concerned with continuous change and its applications.&nbsp; This allowed to optimize functions, which\nmeans to find their maximum or minimum values, as well as to determine other\nvaluable qualities describing functions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today , real-world\napplications are endless, but some examples are maximizing profit, minimizing\nstress, maximizing efficiency, minimizing cost, finding the point of diminishing\nreturns, and determining velocity and acceleration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Integral calculus\nsimply reverses differentiation . This amounts to efficiently adding infinitely\nmany infinitely small numbers. You can find the area of any planar geometric\nshape, or the volume of any geometric solid. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bertrand Russell gave\nan axiomatization of ancient Vedic PROPOSITIONAL LOGIC&nbsp; in his 1906 paper \"The Theory of\nImplication\", and later, along with A. N. Whitehead, produced another\naxiomatization using disjunction and negation as primitives in the 1910 work\nPrincipia Mathematica.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bertrand Russell\ncould NOT think clearly in the above 2000 page book.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term proposition is\nsometimes used synonymously with statement. However, it is sometimes used to\nname something abstract that two different statements with the same meaning are\nboth said to \"express\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Propositional logic,\n(sentential logic )&nbsp; joins and/or\nmodifying entire propositions, statements or sentences to form more complicated\npropositions, statements or sentences, as well as the logical relationships and\nproperties that are derived from these methods of combining or altering\nstatements. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In propositional logic,\nthe simplest statements are considered as indivisible units, and hence,\npropositional logic does not study those logical properties and relations that\ndepend upon parts of statements that are not themselves statements on their\nown, such as the subject and predicate of a statement. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most thoroughly\nresearched branch of propositional logic is classical truth-functional propositional\nlogic, which studies logical operators and connectives that are used to produce\ncomplex statements whose truth-value depends entirely on the truth-values of\nthe simpler statements making them up, and in which it is assumed that every\nstatement is either true or false and not both. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When two statements are\njoined together with \"and\", the complex statement formed by them is\ntrue if and only if both the component statements are true. Because of this, an\nargument of the following form is logically valid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Propositional logic\nlargely involves studying logical connectives such as the words \"and\"\nand \"or\" and the rules determining the truth-values of the\npropositions they are used to join, as well as what these rules mean for the\nvalidity of arguments\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-- and such logical\nrelationships between statements as being consistent or inconsistent with one\nanother, as well as logical properties of propositions, such as being\ntautologically true, being contingent, and being self-contradictory. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Propositional logic\ndoes not deal with logical relationships and properties that involve the parts\nof a statement smaller than the simple statements making it up. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A logical operator is\nany word or phrase used either to modify one statement to make a different\nstatement, or join multiple statements together to form a more complicated\nstatement. In English, words such as \"and\", \"or\",\n\"not\", \"if ... then...\", \"because\", and\n\"necessarily\", are all operators.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The English words\n\"and\", \"or\" and \"not\" are (at least arguably) truth-functional,\nbecause a compound statement joined together with the word \"and\" is\ntrue if both the statements so joined are true, and false if either or both are\nfalse, a compound statement joined together with the word \"or\" is true\nif at least one of the joined statements is true, and false if both joined\nstatements are false, and the negation of a statement is true if and only if\nthe statement negated is false.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Greek Aristotle had NO\nideas of his own other than what was lifted from Kodungallur Univerity in Kerala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aristotle's\nsophisticated half baked writings may be sophisticated for the half wit white\nthinker\u2014but all of it was on logic dealt with the logic of categories and\nquantifiers such as \"all\", and \"some\", which are not\ntreated in propositional logic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He did recognize a need\nfor the development of a doctrine of \"complex\" or \"hypothetical\"\npropositions, i.e., those involving conjunctions (statements joined by\n\"and\"), disjunctions (statements joined by \"or\") and\nconditionals (statements joined by \"if... then...\"),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his metaphysical\nwritings, Aristotle espoused two principles of great importance in\npropositional logic, which have since come to be called the Law of Excluded\nMiddle and the Law of Contradiction. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Interpreted in\npropositional logic, the first is the principle that every statement is either\ntrue or false, the second is the principle that no statement is both true and\nfalse. These are, of course, cornerstones of classical propositional logic<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">George Boole was\nprimarily interested in developing a mathematical-style \"algebra\" to\nreplace Aristotelian syllogistic logic, primarily by employing the numeral\n\"1\" for the universal class, the numeral \"0\" for the empty\nclass, the multiplication notation \"xy\" for the intersection of\nclasses x and y, the addition notation \"x + y\" for the union of\nclasses x and y, etc., so that statements of syllogistic logic could be treated\nin quasi-mathematical fashion as equations; e.g., \"No x is y\" could\nbe written as \"xy = 0\". <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, Boole noticed\nthat if an equation such as \"x = 1\" is read as \"x is true\",\nand \"x = 0\" is read as \"x is false\", the rules given for\nhis logic of classes can be transformed into logic for propositions, with\n\"x + y = 1\" reinterpreted as saying that either x or y is true, and\n\"xy = 1\" reinterpreted as meaning that x and y are both true.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Boolean\nalgebras\" were used to form the basis of the truth-functional\npropositional logics utilized in computer design and programming.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-emHfOFsyVcs/V3Tyq9xNh5I/AAAAAAABKn4/t-poUhOrwx8Q8RCthsFD6IaQw-JGyb7_ACLcB/s1600/slihhde_6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-emHfOFsyVcs/V3Tyq9xNh5I/AAAAAAABKn4/t-poUhOrwx8Q8RCthsFD6IaQw-JGyb7_ACLcB/s640/slihhde_6.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the late 19th\ncentury, German JEW&nbsp; Gottlob Frege (died\n1925) presented logic as a branch of systematic inquiry more fundamental than\nmathematics or algebra, and presented the first modern axiomatic calculus for\nlogic in his 1879 work Begriffsschrift. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Begriffsschrift is\nusually translated as concept writing or concept notation; the full title of\nthe book identifies it as \"a formula language, modeled on that of\narithmetic, of pure thought.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Frege went on to employ\nhis logical calculus in his research on the foundations of mathematics, all\nlifted from the Kerala school of Math.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Logistic system, in\nlogic and mathematics, abstract, theoretical organization of terms and implicit\nrelationships that is used as a tool for the analysis of the concept of\ndeduction.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Logical calculus deals&nbsp; with\nvalidity and satisfiability than with truth or falsity, which are at the root\nof formal systems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gottlob</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Frege\nwas able to show that mathematics grows out of logic, way better than THIEF\nAristotle. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Frege understoof the\nVedic axiomatic predicate logic, which addressed the problem of multiple\ngenerality. Previous logic had dealt with the logical constants and, or, if...\nthen..., not, and some and all, but iterations of these operations, especially\n\"some\" and \"all\", were little understood: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIEF Aristotle's logic\nis unable to represent mathematical statements like Euclid's theorem, a\nfundamental statement of number theory that there are an infinite number of\nprime numbers. Frege's LIFTED conceptual notation could represent such\ninferences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Frege could isolate isolate\ngenuinely logical principles of Anumana ( &nbsp;inference ), so that in the proper\nrepresentation of mathematical proof, one would at no point appeal to\n\"intuition\". <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If there was an\nintuitive element, it was to be isolated and represented separately as an\naxiom: from there on, the proof was to be purely logical and without gaps. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-kvASjGZw928/V3Ty_8pxvYI/AAAAAAABKoE/m2X3R2uJcUU7qi8fnjr258FsWxKOUgCQgCLcB/s1600/pauldirac27jj9316.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"412\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-kvASjGZw928/V3Ty_8pxvYI/AAAAAAABKoE/m2X3R2uJcUU7qi8fnjr258FsWxKOUgCQgCLcB/s640/pauldirac27jj9316.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kerala school of Math\nused math&nbsp; to verify logic, a view known\nas logicism: unlike geometry, arithmetic was to be shown to have no basis in\n\"intuition\", and no need for non-logical axioms.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calculus was the\nmathematical study of change-- geometry was the study of shape and algebra was\nthe study of operations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Differential calculus\n(concerning rates of change and slopes of curves), and integral calculus\n(concerning accumulation of quantities and the areas under and between curves)\nwas used in Kerala astronomy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today German Jew Rothschild\u2019s\nencyclopedia calls German Jew Friedrich Ludwig Gottlob Frege the father of\nanalytic philosophy, -- the philosophy of language and mathematics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BRAAAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Vedanta it is clear\nthat all truth-functional connectives could be defined in terms of negation and\nthe material conditional. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Logic is the science of\nformal principles of reasoning or correct inference.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The difference between mathematical logic and logic\nfor philosophy is that mathematical logic is essentially strictly concerned\nwith deductive logic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;A good course on logic for a philosophy\nprogram should cover deductive, inductive, abductive, meta-logic, and different\nlogical systems(belief logic, modal logic, etc.). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mathematical logic\nwould look at examples of mathematical proofs, whereas logic for philosophy\nwill cover a wide range of scenarios and thought experiments. Mathematical\nlogic is symbolic and formal, Philosophy logic is more informal, more natural\nlanguage oriented<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dialectics and formal\nlogic are sometimes posed as two contrasting forms of reasoning. In this\ncontrast, formal logic is appropriate for reasoning about static properties of\nseparate objects involving no interaction. To deal with change and interaction\nit is necessary to use the dialectic approach.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Wc3qCWzfcKs/V3TyJVSI_XI/AAAAAAABKnw/dwb5oojmErEZ5ybtbO5YC5tXRFXyPrkpQCLcB/s1600/2ccc3ed7fd2601e8f7ww7299ddbf89cbcb.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"302\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Wc3qCWzfcKs/V3TyJVSI_XI/AAAAAAABKnw/dwb5oojmErEZ5ybtbO5YC5tXRFXyPrkpQCLcB/s400/2ccc3ed7fd2601e8f7ww7299ddbf89cbcb.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The philosophy of\nmathematics is concerned with problems that are closely related to central\nproblems of metaphysics and epistemology.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mathematical knowledge\nand the ability to use it is the most important means of tackling quantifiable\nproblems, while philosophical training enhances the ability to analyse issues,\nquestion received assumptions and clearly articulate understanding. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The combination\nprovides a powerful background from which to proceed to graduate study in\neither Mathematics or Philosophy. This was understood by Vedanta 7000 years\nago.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since ancient Vedic times\nthere have been strong links between Mathematics and Philosophy; logic, an\nimportant branch of both subjects, provides a natural bridge between the two,\nas does the philosophy of mathematics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Western philosophies of\nmathematics go as far back as Plato, who studied the ontological status of\nmathematical objects, and Aristotle, who studied logic and issues related to\ninfinity (actual versus potential).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plato studied in Kodungallur University and\nso did Pythagoras.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Somebody asked me \u2013\nwhat is this sy\u0101d-avaktavya\u1e25\u2014&nbsp; in some\nways, it is indescribable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/6Dp27XYjHuk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/6Dp27XYjHuk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Well, Brahman cannot be\nunderstood by logic! <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If it can be\nunderstood, it is not Brahman!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/v657Ylwh-_k/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/v657Ylwh-_k?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the closing of\nMahabharata, seeing his enemies in heaven and his own family in hell\nYudhishthira starts shouting at Krishna and condemning his justice.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was the last waystation\nbefore he entered Sakina,&nbsp; the Great\nPeace at the heart of the Godhead. So the keeper of the last dwelling , the 7th\nastral layer, said to Yudhishthira:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cStop shouting! You\nhave known neither paradise nor hell. Here there is no happiness, no punishment,\nno family, no enemies. Rise in tranquility. Here words end, like thought. This\nwas your last illusion- the veil of MAYA&nbsp;\nis now lifted .\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">The philosophy of ancient India is quite diverse and complex in structure. So complex, in fact, that almost all have given up on making sense of this kaleidoscope.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">MAYA was used to explain that we Hindus are superstitious. &nbsp;Vedanta during the colonial era was looked down upon as an otherworldly approach, regarding the world as maya or illusion that kept India backward.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Yet since the advent of quantum physics reveals that Vedanta is beyond the cutting edge of physics, which is only now, discovering the illusory nature of physical reality and the existence of subtler energy and information currents behind all that we see.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Vedanta is the very science of consciousness at both human and cosmic levels. It recognises consciousness as the ultimate reality and affirms its presence in all existence.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Modern physicists have looked to Vedanta for understanding their proposed unitary field of consciousness behind the universe, to explain the coherence of all cosmic laws and understand the THEORY OF EVERYTHING.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Vedanta is the unitary philosophy explaining the oneness of the individual soul with the universal consciousness.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Superluminal communication is a hypothetical process in which information is sent at faster-than-light (FTL) speeds. If wormholes are possible, then ordinary subluminal methods of communication could be sent through them to achieve superluminal transmission speeds</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">On the surface Quantum Physics (QP) and Vedanta may look very different. One is part of the scientific tradition and the other in some ways is philosophy soaked in spirituality.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Science is trying to understand the universe \u2018out there\u2019 and Vedanta addressed the universe \u2018inside you\u2019\u201d</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">One of the fundamental difference between western philosophy, &nbsp;with that,of Vedanta is that ,the western philosophy believe the universe and everything in the universe belongs to god.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">On the other hand &nbsp;Vedanta philosophy believe that god himself present in each and every atom of this creation ,god is present not only in human, but even in animals ,plants , rocks ,stars planets atom and molecules.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">To a vedantic every part of this universe is dynamic, it is vibrating, it is listening and can respond according to ones KARMA, It can be by action and can be purely thought. The universe listens to our action as well as thought and gives in return what exactly we want either knowingly or unknowingly, weather it is bad or good.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">The scientific tradition is about Science of object. And Vedanta is called science of consciousness or science of subject. And is not a philosophy. Newton\u2019s first law, an object will continue in motion in a straight line with a constant velocity.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; line-height: 24px;\"><b>Have you ever seen such an object on earth or in space? &nbsp; Even retarded children know this today.</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Mundaka Upanishad says: \u201cJust as a spider projects its own web and then re-absorbs it into its own body, so also That One Reality projects this variegated universe and then absorbs it back into it.\u201d&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Sanatana Dharma views the universe as an inseparable web, whose interconnections are dynamic and not static, the cosmic web is alive; it moves and grows and changes continually.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Modern physics, too, has come to conceive of the universe as such a web of relations and, like Vedanta, has recognized that this web is intrinsically dynamic. The dynamic aspect of matter arises in quantum theory as a consequence of the wave-nature of subatomic particles.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Talking about the Quantum Physics we stumbled upon the &nbsp;most bizarre result of quantum theory came when Bell\u2019s theorem and subsequent experiments proved the so called entanglements to be right. In such cases, two or more atoms, electrons or photons demonstrate correlated properties even at distances where no communication is possible between them during the given time.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">These developments are the most important developments in the history of physics and perhaps in the whole of science. They give rise to the idea of the interconnected wholeness of the world and non-local interactions in contrast to the separate identities with local interactions.</span></span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kerala school of\nmath used math as a spiritual activity \u2013based on which astrology thrived.&nbsp; They used math as a &nbsp;most subtle and rigorous form of thought.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Pythagoras and\nPlato studied in the Kerala school of Math at Kodungallur university and they\nintroduced this concept to the west without really understanding the depth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even today, the modern\nmind has NOT reached the bottom of the ancient Indian sage\u2019s mind.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white historian\nmust know that Greek philosophy was stolen from Indian philosophy written 4500\nyears earlier.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Greeks never really\nunderstood the real essence of profound subjects like Epistemology, though\nIndian sages taught them in their own lands. Pythagoras ( died 495 BC ) and\nPlato studied in India.&nbsp; Aristotle lifted\nfrom Vedanta material taken out of India<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plato ( died 348 BC ) ,\na homosexual shared his stolen from Kodungallur University spoils with his\nmentor Socrates ( died 399 BC ) , and fellow homosexual side kick Aristotle (\ndied 322 BC ) and got himself immortalized as the founder of the Academy in\nAthens, the first institution of higher learning in the Western world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aristotle, Socrates and\nPlato were hardcore homosexuals&nbsp; .&nbsp; Aristotle initiated Alexander the great into\nhomosexuality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">TO BE CONTINUED --</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-3s_FgRbiQ4k/V3DF8eQJv9I/AAAAAAABKlc/sI7HGIoHqbQe5IL7_Cf-bXcZKrMYj0QlgCLcB/s1600/IMG_8872%2Bcopy.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
