, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When permafrost thaws,\nmicrobes get active and start decomposing the carbon in the soil to release\nmassive amounts of Methane ( not CO2 ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ice wedges are formed\nwhen groundwater freezes, then \u2014 when the air gets cold enough at minus 17\ndegrees Celsius or lower \u2014 the ice begins to expand and contract, with more ice\nfilling the cracks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eventually the wedge\ngets big enough to reach the surface, where it splits the earth like cracks in\na sidewalk. These ice wedges look like giant honeycombs on the frozen\nlandscape.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Melting ice wedges are\nspeeding up the rate at which permafrost is thawing. Most of the northern\npermafrost has been frozen for thousands of years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All over the northern\nareas giant craters are releasing Methane \u2013this is being kept a secret and the\nZionist Jews are trying to cash in on CARBON TAX from CO2 from unsuspecting\nnations like India.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-IOwvNEwEhpM/V2Ko6UU5EeI/AAAAAAABKJs/fAdqzGVInw0zShXn1zhJF4YnCqWCGRIIwCLcB/s1600/imDDages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"333\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-IOwvNEwEhpM/V2Ko6UU5EeI/AAAAAAABKJs/fAdqzGVInw0zShXn1zhJF4YnCqWCGRIIwCLcB/s400/imDDages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methane is a colorless,\nodorless gas, and it\u2019s also nonpolar \u2014 normally, it behaves like oil in water,\nstubbornly refusing to mix or blend. But a great deal of Earth\u2019s methane was\nproduced by the long-ago decomposition of vast, ancient beds of plankton buried\nin the seafloor under the crushing pressures of the deep ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sheer pressure\nmeans that molecules of methane are physically forced to mingle with water\nmolecules \u2014 hence the name, hydrate. The resultant substance is kept stable in\na solid, even crystalline form by the weight of all that water. This is also\nwhy we don\u2019t find methane clathrates in shallow seas; the pressures there\naren\u2019t enough to keep the methane solid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But with the right kind\nof disturbance, parts of the deep-ocean crystalline hydrate deposits can break\noff and even explode violently as they transition from solid to gas. Oil\nworkers call these gas explosions \u201c Methane burps of death.\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_lnXmkQ1qYA/V2Kp4Eg5RPI/AAAAAAABKKA/xqtYDjuwBf0qPoqv34AVwlvK6ITxJhg9wCLcB/s1600/900c38aea10694d6623V09061c4a2d2ac.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-_lnXmkQ1qYA/V2Kp4Eg5RPI/AAAAAAABKKA/xqtYDjuwBf0qPoqv34AVwlvK6ITxJhg9wCLcB/s400/900c38aea10694d6623V09061c4a2d2ac.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 does NOT explode.&nbsp; Permafrost in the north pole area is thawing\nand spewing methane.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Huge blowholes appear\nfrom time to time, occurring when trapped methane melts and then explodes\ncreating a huge crater. More and more of them are appearing, both on land and\nin the sea. There is a methane pall in the atmosphere around the North Pole\nmoving ever further south.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On February 20th, 2016,\nfor about 12 hours, the NOAA METOP measure recorded a major atmospheric methane\nspike in the range of 3,096 parts per billion at 20,000 feet in altitude.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A polar cap has a purpose\nin nature, to regulate temperature, ocean currents and atmospheric circulation.\nTo cause its melting is to remove a MASSIVE regulatory mechanism . This is a\nsnowballing thingy causing more methane to be released prematurely.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methane is\nthe product of very old decaying matter (plants and trees from long ago) and is\ntrapped predominantly within several meters of the surface in the Arctic Tundra\nand in the form of frozen methane hydrates on the Arctic sea bed. It is\nordinarily locked into permafrost and thus is held in an inert state.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NizOXbhcAIY/V2KqMuHkw8I/AAAAAAABKKM/Ay1mTCoJBogEV8Jrihbf7giy7juNKMpwACLcB/s1600/GFS-025deg_VVVVWORLD-CED_T2_anom.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-NizOXbhcAIY/V2KqMuHkw8I/AAAAAAABKKM/Ay1mTCoJBogEV8Jrihbf7giy7juNKMpwACLcB/s1600/GFS-025deg_VVVVWORLD-CED_T2_anom.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only global warming (or\nan asteroid striking the sea bed) can release what otherwise would be held\nsafely by nature. There are billions of tonnes of methane stored there<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, Methane is more\nthan 104 times stronger than the same mass of carbon dioxide over a 20-year\ntime frame.&nbsp;&nbsp; Methane amplifies warming\ndramatically in the short term.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The warming has\noccurred where the methane is and the disappearance of the sea ice (from 2016\nonwards) will certainly increase methane melt on the seabed. Methane releases in the Arctic Tundra (on land)\ncause regional warmings and a dispersal of greenhouse gas methane throughout\nthe atmosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emissions from fens are generally higher than bogs and\nsome other wetland types because fens, fed by groundwater, have higher nutrient\nlevels and more grasses than bogs, leading to more methane production.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two classes\nof bacteria actively involved in the methane cycle. Methanogenic bacteria generate\nmethane by breaking down organic matter in the absence of oxygen\n(anaerobically), releasing carbon dioxide and methane .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Conversely,\nmethanotrophic bacteria oxidise methane to carbon dioxide \u2013for which India is\nblamed..&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fUqmF80gpso/V2KYHQ2-uPI/AAAAAAABKFE/AMcWoDrbLCsIXAErKNycw2kd9ss4XIS6ACLcB/s1600/methansse1_h1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methanotrophic bacteria are of two sorts; low affinity oxidation,\nwhere methanotrophs oxidise high concentrations of methane at the source of\nproduction (usually a population of methanogenic bacteria), and high affinity\noxidation, which can oxidise methane present at atmospheric concentrations.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-afLCX1FMbnU/V2KYbJl5MlI/AAAAAAABKFQ/-mnII2Sxi4EBa4Wo83cyKxezNQ1clsWZwCLcB/s1600/feedbawwck_mech.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oceans contribute approximately 2% to global\nmethane emissions. The methane is produced by methanogenic bacteria within\nsinking particles in surface waters.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The production of methane from oceans is\nspatially dependent, with much methane arising from methanogenesis in marine\nsediments, particularly in nutrient rich areas such as estuaries.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2Bbx6uZq7hk/V2KYzny88GI/AAAAAAABKFc/c7yYtZyJlBw5XVB5fnK0uYyU7X7tld17wCLcB/s1600/permafrost_arcsetic-1024x557.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since methane\u2019s\nradiative absorption is about 35 times that of CO2 by volume in the IPCC\nclimate assessments (and its short term global warming potential is as much as\n105 times that of a comparable amount of CO2) and since methane release sets\noff other feedbacks by turning into CO2 after it is oxidized and by increasing\natmospheric water vapor, a strong greenhouse agent in its own right, a\nsignificant portion of tundra carbon being liberated as methane results in a\nrather powerful heat amplification. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of the most\nmemorable and devastating storms in eastern North America and western Europe,\npopularly known as superstorms, have been winter cyclonic storms, though\nsometimes occurring in late fall or early spring, that generate\nnear-hurricane-force winds and often large amounts of snowfall. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Heat is transported\nfrom the equator polewards mostly by the atmosphere but also by ocean currents,\nwith warm water near the surface and cold water at deeper levels. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The best known segment\nof this circulation is the GULF STREAM , a wind-driven gyre, which transports\nwarm water from the Caribbean northwards .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vK6S1evx6uk/V2KhVziRIyI/AAAAAAABKHg/8CwTRwJnbFwCXd4H4dITjE_gWTQMxiXPwCLcB/s1600/Arctic_methaneVCX_sources_flat.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-vK6S1evx6uk/V2KhVziRIyI/AAAAAAABKHg/8CwTRwJnbFwCXd4H4dITjE_gWTQMxiXPwCLcB/s640/Arctic_methaneVCX_sources_flat.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Thawing\nof the various types of Arctic permafrost is releasing large amounts of\nOXIDISED METHANE (</span><span style=\"color: blue;\"> carbon dioxide</span><span style=\"color: red;\"> )&nbsp; into\nthe atmosphere.&nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-L_-rYd0XdhI/V2KXqpMRWOI/AAAAAAABKE8/1IttHU2XX_Qj6TX6iWJHM8j9WEQJ_PN3QCLcB/s1600/NL79-fghnmethane-diagram.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"376\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-L_-rYd0XdhI/V2KXqpMRWOI/AAAAAAABKE8/1IttHU2XX_Qj6TX6iWJHM8j9WEQJ_PN3QCLcB/s640/NL79-fghnmethane-diagram.gif\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Subsea permafrost occurs beneath the seabed and exists in the\ncontinental shelves of the polar regions.&nbsp;\nThis source of methane is different from methane clathrates, but\ncontributes to the overall outcome and feedbacks.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From sonar measurements in\nrecent years researchers quantified the density of bubbles emanating from the\nsubsea permafrost into the Ocean (a process called ebullition), and found that\nmore than 800 mg methane per square meters is emitted daily along the East\nSiberian Shelf, into the water column.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arctic cyclones, fueled by global warming and further accumulation of greenhouse\ngases in the atmosphere is releasing more and more from this methane\nsource.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wKlENEshJz8/V2Kb87ZKihI/AAAAAAABKGQ/Jn0ktkKvkBIuhoo8kP124LU9K2moTVPWgCLcB/s1600/Arctic_methanxxe_13_June_2015_fb.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-wKlENEshJz8/V2Kb87ZKihI/AAAAAAABKGQ/Jn0ktkKvkBIuhoo8kP124LU9K2moTVPWgCLcB/s640/Arctic_methanxxe_13_June_2015_fb.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">Low pressure systems\nhave come to dominate the Arctic Ocean zone. &nbsp; Outwardly expanding\ncounter-clockwise winds from these systems have tended to cause the ice to\nspread out in a deceptive manner , and to thin drastically.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KVOat9FjHVw/V2KlYwX1hLI/AAAAAAABKIo/-2GjJ8VgbjERZqaWY33KKKdDkAzzM1vuACLcB/s1600/5D00.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GBRdvMmYCzY/V2KbEZI5iYI/AAAAAAABKGA/WYjUvhfXJSUO3zENqi6_wQYxeUkfZbZ2gCLcB/s1600/atmosmsethanemar2015.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The poles of the Earth are more sensitive to\nany change in the planet's climate than the rest of the planet. In the face of\nongoing global warming, the poles are warming faster than lower latitudes. The\nprimary cause of this phenomenon is ice-albedo feedback, whereby melting ice\nuncovers darker land or ocean beneath, which then absorbs more sunlight,\ncausing more heating.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ar1xycIF1IU/V2KhCozOBdI/AAAAAAABKHY/35guc1q5qo8KXxKpx1PJvF4z6ypsEBHUwCLcB/s1600/methane-escapes-permafrost.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Billions of years ago,\nmethane producing cyanobacteria or archaea were prevalent in the world\u2019s\noceans. The methane they produced helped keep the Earth warm at a time when\nsolar output was much less than it is today.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Later, as oxygen producing plants\nemerged, the archaea, to which oxygen was a poison, retreated into the anoxic\ncorners of the more modern world. Today, they live in the dark, in the mud, or\nin the depths of oceans. This is Brahma/ Vishna/Shiva the TRINITY at work.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5863652625719077211\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_10M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/04866063493849159930\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Unknown</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html?showComment=1466047878502#c5863652625719077211\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">June 16, 2016 at 9:01 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_10MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nDear Captain,<br />\n<br />\nYou have written -<br />\n<br />\n\"But a great deal of Earth\u2019s methane was produced by the long-ago decomposition of vast, ancient beds of plankton buried in the seafloor under the crushing pressures of the deep ocean.\"<br />\n<br />\nThis means you don't believe in abiotic origin of petroleum crude / hydrocarbon theory. However, the Abiotic theory looks much more logical and also gels with the Madhu Soodana / Madhu Kaitava story where Madhu is - Primordial Hydrocarbon, indicating the original gaseous state of Earth, like many other planets.<br />\n<br />\nWould like to know your comments about the above.<br />\n<br />\nregards</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There, they continue to eek out an existence by turning hydrogen and carbon\ndioxide into methane.&nbsp; A kind of archaea,\nnamed methanoflorens stordalenmirensis, is exploding through sections of\nrapidly melting Swedish tundra.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fact, it is so at home in regions of melting\npermafrost that it blooms in the same way algae blooms in the ocean. As a\nresult, it comes to dominate the microbial environment, representing 90% of the\nmethanogens and crowding out many of the other microbes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LtudFJ5k7Eo/V2LjJVgXZrI/AAAAAAABKLs/s4fK8-UzDOMbIUMtRdU3mr0dLjt_ebW2QCLcB/s1600/hydrate-crystal-273x30s0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LtudFJ5k7Eo/V2LjJVgXZrI/AAAAAAABKLs/s4fK8-UzDOMbIUMtRdU3mr0dLjt_ebW2QCLcB/s400/hydrate-crystal-273x30s0.jpg\" width=\"364\" /></a></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methanoflorens\nstordalenmirensis is an indicator species for melting permafrost. It is rarely\nfound where there is permafrost, but where the peat is warmer and the\npermafrost is melting, it just grows and grows.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is possible that we can use\nit to measure the health of mires and their permafrost. The recently documented\nglobal distribution also shows, on a much larger scale, that this microbe\nspreads to new permafrost areas in time with them thawing out. This is not good\nnews for a stable climate,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So what we have here is\na billions year old microbe that thrives in wet regions called mires where\npermafrost is melting, rapidly converts tundra carbon to methane, readily\nspreads to new zones where permafrost melt occurs, and explodes into algae like\nblooms to dominate these environments.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One could not ask for a set of more\ndiabolic little helpers for the already very disturbing Arctic Methane Monster\u2026<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oceans are\nnaturally alkaline, with an average pH of around 8.2, although this can vary up\nto 0.3 units depending on location and season. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Atmospheric carbon\ndioxide dissolves naturally in the ocean, forming carbonic acid (H2CO3), a weak\nacid.&nbsp;&nbsp; Carbon dioxide in water is a very\nweak acid, whilst the ocean is a very stable buffer<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The concentration\nof&nbsp; CO2 to significantly reduce that pH\nwill not come from the atmosphere \u2013 there isn\u2019t enough CO2 in the atmosphere to\nmake much difference.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 constitutes&nbsp; about 0.04% (400 parts per million) of the\natmosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 does NOT cause\nglobal warming as the oceans act as a sink. Colder oceans absorb more CO2.\nCarbon dioxide is an integral part of the carbon cycle, a biogeochemical cycle\nin which carbon is exchanged between the Earth's oceans, soil, rocks and\nbiosphere.&nbsp;&nbsp; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CCS is done in three\nmain steps-- to carbon capture and storage (CCS) -- trapping and separating the\nCO2 from other gases, transporting this captured CO2 to a storage location, and\nstoring that CO2 far away from the atmosphere (underground or deep in the\nocean).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; They are expensive to build, require\nmeticulous maintenance, and yet unreliable. Since wind current is unsteady,\nwind turbines are intermittent and need conventional power plants for backup. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moreover, wind farms\nare ugly , and they make humming noise that drives you crazy due to&nbsp; Wind Turbine Syndrome--people run away.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People still believe in\nthings that sound too good to be true. They fall for con artists and Ponzi\nschemes. Now they believe wind and solar energy are absolutely clean and free.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; IS UNRELIABLE.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT IS OK IF PEOPLE WANT\nTO USE SOLAR PANELS ON INDIVIDUAL HOMES TO HEAT WATER OF RUN SMALL LIGHTS AND\nFANS USING AN INVERTER .&nbsp; THIS WORKS WELL\nWHERE THERE ARE TOO MANY POWER CUTS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the talk of the\nsmart grid wouldn't be nearly so complex if solar and wind, if they&nbsp; were a reliable supply.&nbsp;&nbsp; But those resources are variable, and the\ngaps must be compensated by traditional bulk power generation, effectively\ndefeating the purpose of a renewable source.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grid operators don't\ncontrol VRE, ( solar / wind variable renewable enery ) they accommodate it,\nwhich requires some agility.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How many of our IIT electrical\nengineers churned out in hundreds every year &nbsp;know how to read a simple circuit diagram ? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oh yeah ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tell them to take this ELEMENTARY test.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN WE HAVE ABUNDANT\nCOAL RESERVES IT MAKES ZILCH SENSE TO GO FOR UNRELIABLE WIND POWER, WHICH CAN\nSPOIL EXPENSIVE EQUIPMENT .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAINTAINING\n50 HERTZ IS IMPORTANT FOR MOST EQUIPMENT&nbsp;\n.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The wind industry\nclaims that wind energy is cost competitive, so let wind compete in a\ncompetitive market with natural gas, coal, and other energy sources.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are very few\nareas in India having strong and steady winds. Whose MAD idea is all this ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consumers, not BIG\nBROTHER, should choose the energy sources that work best for us.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the great\nquestions about any energy system is how much energy do you get back after the\nenergy it took to actually make your power plant or wind turbine?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I WAS ONCE A GREAT FAN\nOF RECHARGEABLE AA BATTERIES .&nbsp;&nbsp; I HAVE\nLEARNT MY LESSON<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is called&nbsp; ERoEI (Energy Return on Energy Invested),\nwhich takes the energy returned and divides it by the cost of building the\nthing in the first place!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most renewables have good\nERoEI\u2019s on face value. They always hide&nbsp;\nenergy cost of building the \u201cstorage\u201d for wind and solar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now SKODA says \u2013BUY A\nCAR TODAY FOR FREE AND PAY FOR IT AFTER TWO YEARS. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So hey scare Zionist\nJew mongers consider this science project.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Convert CO2 from your\ncoal plant funnel exhaust into Baking Soda by an elementary science reaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 + H2O + NaCl&nbsp; = NaHCO3 + H2 + Cl2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Children put baking\nsoda into their aquariums to de-acidify and give more health to the coral at\nthe bottom of the glass reservoir. So why dont you CHOOTS do the same thing ,\ninstead of crying about it? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You do it--we in India\nwill NOT do it. We Indians are NOT fuckin' stupid. You are the ones stuck with\nCHOOTIYA white sand --not us.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BY THE WAY-- I AM DEAD\nSERIOUS ABOUT CONVERSION OF CO2 INTO BAKING SODA AND USING IT TO REVIVE CORAL\nREEFS DESTROYED BY LOCAL ACID POLLUTION ( NOT CO2 )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 + H2O + NaCl \u2013&gt;\nNaHCO3 + H2 + Cl2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 enters absorption\nchambers where it is treated with sodium hydroxide - caustic soda - made from\nsalt (sodium chloride, or NaCl) and water (H2O).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon dioxide, water\nand salt react to produce sodium bicarbonate (baking soda), hydrogen gas and\nchlorine gas. Hydrogen and chlorine gas have commercial uses themselves, or\nboth can be easily dissolved in water to create hydrochloric acid (HCl), an\nimportant industrial solvent.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corals are NOT alone in\ntheir dependence on the carbonate dissolved in seawater. Other calcifers\ninclude marine snails (pteropods); shellfish (clams, etc.); crustaceans such as\nshrimp and lobsters; starfish, sea urchins and their kin (echinoderms); even\nsingle-celled amobae called foraminifera and photosynthetic algae called\ncoccolithophores, which encase themselves in calcium carbonate platelets<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ocean is full of\norganisms known as calcifers\u2014creatures large and small (and very small), which\nuse carbonate and calcium ions dissolved in seawater to construct their shells\nand skeletons of calcium carbonate (CaCO3), a base.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most famous among the\nmarine calcifers are the corals, which build reefs of CaCO3 that are some of\nthe greatest hotspots of biodiversity in the ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TOH KARO NAH-- CHOONA\nLAGAAKE ! <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DHAKKAN !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PRAY, WHAT IS &nbsp;REACTION BELOW , WHICH HAPPENS IN SEA WATER ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO2 + H2O + NaCl&nbsp; = NaHCO3 + H2 + Cl2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN CO2 REACTS WITH\nSALT IN OCEAN WHAT HAPPENS YOU DRIPPING CUNTS ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IS NaHCO3&nbsp; ( SODIUM BI CARBONATE ) ACID OR BASE YOU\nMORONS ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DOES THIS REACTION ADD\nTO THE SHELL OF MOLLUSCA OR ERODE THEIR SHELLS ,&nbsp; YOU SONS OF BITCHES ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHY DO YOU THINK GOD PUT\nSALT IN THE BUFFERING OCEANS -YOU PARIS COP21 \"CREAMY SHIT\nLAYER\"&nbsp; CHOOTS ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When CO2 from the\natmosphere reacts with seawater, it immediately forms carbonic acid<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(H2CO3), which in\nitself is unstable. This further dissociates to form bicarbonate and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">carbonate ions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bicarbonate and\ncarbonate ions are responsible for the buffering capacity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">of seawater, i.e.\nseawater can resist drastic pH changes even after the addition of weak bases<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">and acids. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The carbonate ion can\nreact with calcium ions (Ca), which are in excess in<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">seawater, to form\ncalcium carbonate (CaCO3), the material out of which the shells of mussels,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the skeleton of corals\nand the exoskeleton of some microalgae is made of.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In seawater carbon\ndioxide becomes carbonic acid, which in turn forms bicarbonate and carbonate\nions. The levels of these are important because they control the pH of\nseawater. This is a measure of how acid or alkaline the water is. Seawater has\na relatively stable pH of about 8.3<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oceans as a buffer sink\nkeep carbon dioxide at around 0.035%<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most \"CO2\" in\nthe ocean exists neither as dissolved CO2(aq) nor as carbonate, CO3 (2-).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instead, most exists as\nthe bicarbonate ion HCO3-.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hey, you Paris COP21\nCUNTs&nbsp; have you got this ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkalinity is sometimes\nincorrectly used interchangeably with basicity.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, the pH of\na solution can be lowered by the addition of CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">. This will reduce the basicity;\nhowever, the alkalinity will remain unchanged. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You see, in common use,\n\u201calkaline\u201d is used to mean \u201cbasic\u201d or \u201copposite of acidic\u201d. That isn\u2019t strictly\ncorrect; though often the two things, alkalinity and basicity, are \u2018fellow\ntravelers\u2019 in chemical reactions, so folks commonly treat them as the same thing.\nThey are not.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An acid is a proton\ndonor (there are a couple of other definitions too, such as based on electron\npairs or \u2026) where a base is a proton acceptor. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alkaline does not mean\nthat. It means a specific neutralization point related to carbonate. That\ndifference makes all the difference in the world as it relates to CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adding CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> to sea water&nbsp; does NOT \u201cincrease acidity\u201d as the ocean is\nnot acidic, it is basic (8.3 pH ). More importantly, adding CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> also does not make the\nocean \u201cless alkaline\u201d either!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At neutral pH values:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> + H</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">O \u2192 HCO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2083</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2212 + H+<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At high pH values:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> + H</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2082</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">O \u2192 HCO</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria math&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2083</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> \u00b2- + 2H+<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, so, so-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a creamy shit\nlater Paris COP21 CHOOT moans&nbsp; about\n\u201cocean acidification\u201d and CO2, give him a kick on his KOSHER ass and tell him\nthat the ocean is alkaline and adding more CO2 to the ocean does not change the\nalkalinity at all.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After that drag him by\nhis nostrils to China Town.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Salt in the ocean allows the oceans to act as\na SINK for CO2 without increasing acidity\u2014 rather it increases the buffering\naction and causes the ocean NOT to become more acidic OR alkaline \u2013 when\ndissolved CO2 increases OR decreases due to water temperature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On paper the buildup of\nwind and solar looks colossal in Germany .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fantastic nameplate\ncapacity trumpeted in the KOSHER media is a drastically misleading measure of\nthe electricity added to the grid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While wind and solar\nnameplate capacity represented 85.1 % of Germany\u2019s average electric power\ngeneration of 72 GW, it ultimately generated only&nbsp; 9.93 % of total electricity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAJJA HAI--KISSI KOH\nKUCHCH NAHI PATHA!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The standard measure of\nthat shortfall in electricity production compared to nameplate capacity is the\n\u201ccapacity factor\u201d: the amount of electricity a generator produces in a year\ndivided by the amount it would produce if it ran at nameplate capacity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The capacity factor in\nGermany is a pathetic&nbsp; 15.93 %.&nbsp; By comparison, fossil-fueled plants can\nachieve capacity factors of 83% or more.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To avoid blackouts and\noverloads, due to unstable wind/ solar systems , the power grid has to match\ngeneration with consumption on a moment-to-moment basis, not on a yearly basis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since it\u2019s difficult\nand SUPER expensive to store electricity on a significant scale, the grid can\u2019t\nbank much excess electricity production to draw on later during shortfalls; it\nhas to reliably produce all the power demanded each moment, largely from generators\nthen on line.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wind turbines and\nphotovoltaic panels generate power when the wind and sun decree, often going\ndead when electricity is needed and then overproducing when it isn\u2019t. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grid managers dread\nthat kind of catastrophic unreliability, but it\u2019s a daily reality for wind and\nsolar. Why does this take a retired ship-captain to tell you all this , APCO\nModi ?&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HOW MANY ELECTRICAL\nGRID EXPERTS DO WE HAVE IN INDIA?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8zRugSzpnz0/V2OR8qk5AgI/AAAAAAABKNw/3Qr1z_YHvgUQLOVe9od1tDrJuIJPJwmNwCLcB/s1600/58809e9S94.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A carbon credit (often\ncalled a carbon offset) is a KOSHER financial instrument ( which made Al Gore a\nCARBON BILLIONAIRE ) that represents a tonne of CO2 (carbon dioxide) or CO2e\n(carbon dioxide equivalent gases) removed or reduced from the atmosphere from\nan emission reduction project, which can be used, by governments, industry or\nprivate individuals to offset damaging carbon emissions that they are\ngenerating.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon credits are\nassociated with either removing existing CO2 or CO2e emissions from the\natmosphere in the case of carbon sequestration from forests and planting of\ntrees or the reduction of future CO2 or CO2e emissions from renewable energy\nand energy efficiency projects that displace fossil fuel power generation\nproduction or industrial processes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon credits\noriginate from a range of emission reduction activities associated with the\nremoval of existing emissions from the atmosphere and the reduction of future\nemissions. These are commonly called KOSHER \"methodologies\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Afforestation and\nreforestation activities are a key means by which existing emissions can be\nremoved from the atmosphere and carbon credits created while construction of a\nUSELESS UNSTEADY KOSHER wind farm rather than a EFFICIENT WORKHORSE coal-fired\npower station may create carbon credits through reducing future emissions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>BRRAAAAAAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY\n!</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RUSSIAN PRESIDENT PUTIN\nHAS SPAT IN THE EYE OF BRICS AND SUPPORTED ROTHSCHILD/ BILDERBERG CO2 AGENDA AT\nPARIS COP21 --&nbsp; SINCE THEN I HAVE STOPPED\nSUPPORTING HIM.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But today\u2019s society has\nbeen indoctrinated to think \u201ccarbon credits\u201d (hot air) are a good deal, worth\nenriching only a handful of leftist elitists like Al Gore, who are raking in\nbillions in cold cash selling nothing but hot air.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emissions trading, or\ncap-and-trade schemes, which allow companies to buy or sell \u201ccredits\u201d that\ncollectively bind all participating companies to an overall emissions limit.\nWhile markets operate for specific pollutants such as greenhouse gases and acid\nrain, by far the biggest emissions market is for carbon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2007, itself the\nKOSHER&nbsp; trade market for C02 credits hit\n$60 billion worldwide\u2014almost double the amount from 2006.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under a basic\ncap-and-trade scheme, if a company\u2019s carbon emissions fall below a set\nallowance, that company can sell the difference\u2014in the form of credits\u2014to other\ncompanies that exceed their limits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is like if you go\nto the gym where they allow only 30 minutes on the threadmill, you can run for\n15 minutes and sell the remaining 15 minutes to someone who wants to run 45\nminutes.&nbsp;
