text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FWQQEGiXrjY/V2PLS5oEeFI/AAAAAAABKP8/h8gAxBEZq2sme8qsVseeecKH5r1ka7HkACLcB/s1600/dowEEnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"359\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FWQQEGiXrjY/V2PLS5oEeFI/AAAAAAABKP8/h8gAxBEZq2sme8qsVseeecKH5r1ka7HkACLcB/s640/dowEEnload.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AAA- BULLSHIT ABOUT CO2\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Carbon dioxide (CO2) is\nthe main contributor to climate change</span> due to the quantities released into the\natmosphere. Since the beginning of the Industrial Revolution, concentrations of\ncarbon dioxide have increased by 31%. The concentration of greenhouse gases,\nlike CO2 have increased due to human activity, chiefly deforestation,\nagriculture, and the use of fossil fuels. </span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">The entire scientific community\nagrees on the fact that global temperatures are increasing due to </span><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>this</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">\nincrease,</span></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"> proven by 2015 being the warmest year since records began. This\nincrease in temperature is already causing ice in the Arctic and <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Antarctic to\nmelt.</span><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BBB --BULLSHIT ABOUT\nARCTIC ICE MELT \u2013 60 METRES MY ASS .&nbsp;\nEVEN AS ARCTIC ICE CAP IS MELTING\u2014ANTARCTIC ICE IS BUILDING <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE :&nbsp; The complete melting of the polar ice caps is\nexpected to <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">bring the sea level up by 60m </span>(210ft) which would engulf large coastal\ncities like London, New York and Shanghai, and even flood parts of inland\nmetropolises like Paris, Berlin and Baghdad. UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CCC - NOT A WORD ABOUT\nNITROUS OXIDE WHICH CREATED THE OZONE LAYER DEPLETION <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE \u201cThe Montreal\nProtocol of 1987 was fairly successful at reducing the production and use of\nhalogenated hydrocarbons, substances that <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">deplete the ozone layer,</span> such as\nchlorofluorocarbons (used in hairspray, coolants, refrigerators, freezers, air\nconditioning).UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">LYING KOSHER MEDIA</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">https://globalnewsbulletin.org/2016/06/04/addressing-climate-change-could-international-policies-for-emissions-be-the-answer/</span><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; color: red;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 250%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html\"><span style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html</span></a><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Even if we ceased ALL\nHUMAN EMISSIONS , permafrost would continue to thaw and release carbon into the\natmosphere. There is no way to capture emissions from thawing permafrost as\nthis carbon is released from soils across large regions of land in very remote\nspaces.&nbsp; You must know that Nitrous oxide\nhas NO carbon in it.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\"></span></b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>The\ntroposphere, is the largest sink for methane. &nbsp; Methane in the troposphere reacts\nwith hydroxyl (OH) radicals, forming mainly water and carbon dioxide.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/--feUzhbfiwk/V2PWuwRDU5I/AAAAAAABKQM/ZtOyYnae6q0HgKe6Hbimp_PtkAsL1gMhwCLcB/s1600/sliddde_9.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/--feUzhbfiwk/V2PWuwRDU5I/AAAAAAABKQM/ZtOyYnae6q0HgKe6Hbimp_PtkAsL1gMhwCLcB/s640/sliddde_9.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methane is removed from\nthe atmosphere (i.e. converted to less harmful products) by a range of chemical\nand biological processes, which occur in different regions of the atmosphere.\nThese include tropospheric oxidation, stratospheric oxidation and uptake by\nsoils.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tropospheric\noxidation:-The predominant mechanism for removal of methane from the\nearth\u2019s&nbsp; tmosphere is oxidation within\nthe troposphere by the hydroxyl radical (OH). The hydroxyl radical is\nresponsible for the breakdown and removal of a host of trace gases, including\nmethane, and for this reason is known as the \u2018cleanser of the atmosphere\u2019.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fE8daUcwAOs/V2PXui_glYI/AAAAAAABKQg/CDh5KeEjKNw4B32n9ngE_Z7er5nNjVqbACLcB/s1600/image_rrrfull.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"492\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-fE8daUcwAOs/V2PXui_glYI/AAAAAAABKQg/CDh5KeEjKNw4B32n9ngE_Z7er5nNjVqbACLcB/s640/image_rrrfull.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nessence, atmospheric OH effects a low temperature combustion of \u2018fuels\u2019, such\nas methane and other hydrocarbon species, by eventually oxidising methane to\ncarbon dioxide, as would happen if methane were burned.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ucPEr4biXkk/V2PYM-TIV_I/AAAAAAABKQs/moOb0IXmUEka22rztj0iAgAczhXIJqkLgCLcB/s1600/ml_378524493402778_davmddodelsumwin.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"474\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ucPEr4biXkk/V2PYM-TIV_I/AAAAAAABKQs/moOb0IXmUEka22rztj0iAgAczhXIJqkLgCLcB/s640/ml_378524493402778_davmddodelsumwin.gif\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The atmosphere is an\noxidizing medium.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of the methane present in the\ntroposphere passes into the stratosphere. Approximately 40 Mt of methane are\noxidised in the stratosphere, representing 7% of all methane removal. The\nchemistry of methane in the lower stratosphere is identical to that in the\ntroposphere, with hydroxyl radicals oxidising methane in the same manner.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indeed, oxidation of methane to carbon\ndioxide and water is the source of approximately 50% of stratospheric water &nbsp;vapour. OH radical as a strong oxidant in the\nstratosphere. OH reacts rapidly with most reduced non-radical species, and is\nparticularly reactive toward H-containing molecules due to H-abstraction\nreactions converting OH to H2O<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-wro1zTa3Eqg/V2PXZ_7XB5I/AAAAAAABKQY/Fi6k_6pS3ScS3XakXryky7f-4mLOxcd-QCLcB/s1600/sceehematic.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-wro1zTa3Eqg/V2PXZ_7XB5I/AAAAAAABKQY/Fi6k_6pS3ScS3XakXryky7f-4mLOxcd-QCLcB/s640/sceehematic.gif\" width=\"524\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">An indirect effect of atmospheric methane\noxidation is that it can magnify the effects of other pollutants. &nbsp; Increased\nmethane in the atmosphere means fewer OH radicals and so less oxidizing power\nin the atmosphere as a whole.</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_72M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrous oxide, also\nknown as dinitrogen oxide or dinitrogen monoxide, is a chemical compound with\nchemical formula N2O. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrous oxide\nreacts with ozone in the stratosphere and is the main naturally occurring\nregulator of stratospheric ozone.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrous oxide gives rise to Nitric oxide on\nreaction with oxygen atoms, and this NO in turn reacts with ozone<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-decoration: none;\">June 18, 2016 at 1:45 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_84MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://www.businessinsider.com/ap-kerry-tours-arctic-circle-to-see-climate-change-impact-2016-6?IR=T<br />\n<br />\nOH YES-- WE KNOW ARCTIC ICE IS MELTING<br />\n<br />\nKERRY WENT THERE TO LIE THAT IT IS DUE TO CARBON DI OXIDE RELEASED BY INDIA.<br />\n<br />\nPermafrost in the Arctic, where air temperatures are rising twice as fast as the rest of the planet, is starting to thaw.<br />\n<br />\nSea ice in the arctic has never melted this much since man came on earth\u2014the water temperature could not rise above zero because of the ice cover\u2026<br />\n<br />\nThe permafrost is acting as a cap for a very large amount of methane (CH4), which is sitting in the sediments underneath in the form of methane hydrates.<br />\n<br />\nYou release the pressure by removing that permafrost and methane comes out as huge bubble plumes.<br />\n<br />\nIt\u2019s already happening.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IN 1998 THE CORAL IN GREAT BARRIER REEF WAS\nBLEACHED .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/--YqqU207Vtk/V2UnuJ9bITI/AAAAAAABKRc/wHZqOn_UGdMw4oxjH0BLGLLXeGvCJ6MxgCLcB/s1600/coral-reef-cc-USFWS-Pacific-Reccgion-2011-big.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/--YqqU207Vtk/V2UnuJ9bITI/AAAAAAABKRc/wHZqOn_UGdMw4oxjH0BLGLLXeGvCJ6MxgCLcB/s640/coral-reef-cc-USFWS-Pacific-Reccgion-2011-big.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Experiment :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Take two identical\nplain sodas. &nbsp;Basically water aerated\nwith Carbon Dioxide<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Open both bottles at\nthe same time .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Keep one bottle in ice\nwater and the other in hotwater<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After 5 minutes take a\nsip<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cold soda will have\nCO2 gas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The warm soda will be\nflat like water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cold water retains CO2\ngas . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Warm water releases CO2\ngas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why in hot\nyears El Nino years , oceans release Carbon Dioxide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before the west started\nFRACKING and leaking Methane there was NO El Nino\u2014it was unheard of.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Warmer water\ntemperatures can result in coral bleaching. When water is too warm, corals will\nexpel the algae (zooxanthellae) living in their tissues causing the coral to\nturn completely white. When a coral bleaches, it is not dead. Corals can\nsurvive a bleaching event<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coral bleaching occurs\nwhen the relationship between the coral host and zooxanthellae, which give\ncoral much of their colour, breaks down. Without the zooxanthellae, the tissue\nof the coral animal appears transparent and the coral's bright white skeleton\nis revealed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS IS A UNIQUE\nPARTNERSHIP \u2013 ONE GIVES FOOD, THE OTHER GIVES SHELTER<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You give me your mango, I give you my banana type.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In exchange for the\ncoral providing them with a protected place to live and some compounds they\nneed for photosynthesis ( carbon dioxide) the algae in turn give the coral\noxygen, glucose and other photosynthates it uses for respiration and other\nmetabolic functions. Zooxanthellae can deliver up to 100% of the daily required\nenergy budget for corals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main cause of coral\nbleaching is heat stress resulting from high sea temperatures and in Australia\nis has been seen during El Nino years . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In El Nino year 1998,\nthere was a global mass bleaching event where 56% t of the reefs on the Great\nBarrier Reef suffered bleaching. I predicted this in my blogpost on El Nino\nabove \u2013it is a reproduction from my Company\u2019s news magazine . It sent it while\nI was on board and I received a copy of the magazine while I was on board.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the water in the\nreef gets too warm, the coral will expel the algae from their tissue, leaving\nthe coral with a ghastly \"bleached\" appearance. At that point, the\ncoral lose a key source of food and become more susceptible to deadly diseases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Often many coral will then die off, which in\nturn can adversely affect the fish that rely on the reefs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Right now as I type,\nAustralia is suffering the WORST EVER&nbsp;\nmass bleaching events since man came on planet earth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Zooxanthellae, which\nlive inside the coral and produce food using the sun's energy.. The symbiotic\nrelation is based on the corals inability to generate sufficient amounts of\nfood and the Zoozanthellae algae\u2019s ability for photosynthesis and converting\nchemical elements into energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The coral in return\nprovides protection as well as a nutrient rich environment for excellent algae\ngrowth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corals are completely\ndependent on the symbiotic algae.&nbsp;&nbsp; They\nwould not be able to survive without them since they can\u2019t produce sufficient\namounts of food. The zooxanthellae can provide all the nutrients necessary, in\nmost cases all the carbon needed for the coral to build the calcium carbonate\nskeleton.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since light is\nessential for photosynthesis hard corals are not found below 75 meters. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corals can adjust the\nalgae population on a daily basis by releasing or by taking up algae as needed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In cases of excessive\nalgae growth or temporary nutrient shortage, the coral can directly feed off\nthe excess algae.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Corals also eat by\ncatching tiny floating animals called zooplankton. At night, coral polyps come\nout of their skeletons to feed, stretching their long, stinging tentacles to\ncapture critters that are floating by. Prey are pulled into the polyps\u2019 mouths\nand digested in their stomachs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, zooxanthellae,\nthe symbiotic algae that LIVE within their tissues and give the coral its\ncolor.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The coral PROVIDE FOOD ( CO2 )\nthat the algae need for photosynthesis. In turn, the algae nourish the coral\nwith oxygen and the organic products of photosynthesis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The coral uses these\ncompounds to synthesize calcium carbonate (limestone) with which it constructs\nits skeleton\u2014the coral reef.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SO YOU </span><span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>CUNTS</b></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> , CAN STOP\nGIVING BULL ABOUT OCEAN ACIDIFICATION DUE TO INDIA RELEASING CO2 FROM OUR COAL\nPOWER PLANETS AND BY CREMATING OUR DEAD .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; What is making Europe so warm ?<br />\n<br />\nNitrous oxide, a highly potent greenhouse gas is now being released from a warming Arctic<br />\n<br />\nNitrous oxide emissions have increased from Arctic peatlands following permafrost thaw- caused by Methane release.<br />\n<br />\nIf the GLOBAL WARMING POTENTIAL ( GWP ) is 1 for Carbon Dioxide, it is 302 for Nitrous oxide and 104 for Methane over a 20 year period.<br />\n<br />\nPARIS COP21 KICKED METHANE AND NITROUS OXIDE UNDER THE KOSHER CARPET SO THAT THE JEWS CAN BLAME CO2 AS THE VILLAIN AND MAKE MONEY OUT OF THIN AIR ( CARBON CREDIT- OFFSET ).<br />\n<br />\nAT THE G20 SUMMIT IN HAMBURG 2017- ALL WORLD LEADERS ( INCLUDING MODI ) WERE IN JEW ROTHSCHILDs POCKET EXCEPT DONALD TRUMP.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html<br />\n<br />\nWE ASK PM MODI\u2014WHAT IS THE USE OF HAVING AN ICE STATION HEMADRI AT ARCTIC? HAVE THE SCIENTISTS GONE THERE TO HAVE BOOZE AND ENJOY ?<br />\n<br />\nMore than 70 billion tons of nitrogen stocks are stored in the upper 3.5 metres of permafrost soil, a vast sum accumulated over thousands of years through the nitrogen cycle<br />\n<br />\nThe permafrost stocks are more than 600 times larger than the annual nitrogen load added as GM fertiliser to soils globally<br />\n<br />\nSome of that nitrogen already exists in the form of \u201cold\u201d nitrous oxide, built up during the permafrost formation, while other mineralized nitrogen interacts with microbes to produce \u201cnew\u201d nitrous oxide.<br />\n<br />\nNitrous oxide that is released into the atmosphere remains in the troposphere for more than a century and then it migrates to the stratosphere, where it depletes the ozone layer. The ozone layer serves as a protective barrier absorbing solar radiation; without it the sun\u2019s ultraviolet rays would severely damage biological organisms, including humans.<br />\n<br />\nAlthough the Montreal Protocol, an international treaty signed in 1987 to protect the ozone layer, Nitrous oxide was ignored. The Zionist Jews concentrated on WEE ozone depleting items ( like refrigerants ) where they can make money out of thin air.<br />\n<br />\nLoss of nitrogen to the atmosphere may also reduce plant biomass, further contributing to climate change.<br />\n<br />\nIf nitrogen is lost to the atmosphere, plant growth won't be able to compensate for carbon being lost from permafrost soils<br />\n<br />\nThe most alarming phenomenon in the Arctic is the loss of the highly reflective snow and ice cover, known as the albedo..<br />\n<br />\nHigh nitrous oxide saturations were recently observed in productive shallow Arctic shelf waters following significant reduction in sea ice cover..<br />\n<br />\nNitrous oxide is produced in the ocean water column and sediments by two pathways. The first is in oxygen-rich conditions in which ammonium is converted to nitrate, creating nitrous oxide as a byproduct. The second occurs in deoxygenated sediments where nitrous oxide is produced in an intermediate stage between the conversion of nitrate to nitrogen gas.<br />\n<br />\nThe loss of sea ice cover in Arctic shelf waters has resulted in increased sunlight absorption, fueling phytoplankton growth. Following phytoplankton death, organic material is remineralized to ammonium, which can be converted to nitrate and ultimately produce nitrous oxide.<br />\n<br />\nWhat happens in the Arctic doesn\u2019t stay in the Arctic ( unlike the Cricket team dressing room politics )<br />\n<br />\nIndians were the first to use BIOCHAR for agriculture . It converts agricultural waste into a soil enhancer that can hold carbon, boost food security, and increase soil biodiversity, and discourage deforestation. The process creates a fine-grained, highly porous charcoal that helps soils retain nutrients and water.<br />\n<br />\nIndia was blessed with HUMUS laden topsoil with healthy microbes and earthworms for millions of years. Just 55 years of desh drohi GREEN REVOLUTION has decimated our holy topsoil.<br />\n<br />\n90% of our lakes have disappeared.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_140BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4825902412175952017\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_138M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; text-decoration-line: none;\">August 6, 2017 at 9:34 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_138MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\nOur hospitals are full die to the effects of NITROSAMINES and EVIL PHARMA is laughing all the way to the bank with \u201cAlice in Wonderland \u201c PM Modi clapping from the sidelines<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/05/nitrate-water-pollution-chemical.html<br />\n<br />\nRead all 6 pats of the post below--<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/05/ground-water-resources-of-india-capt.html<br />\n<br />\nWE WANT OUR NCERT TEXT BOOKS TO EXPOUND THE IMPORTANCE OF HAVING HUMUS LADEN TOP SOIL AND BASICS ABOUT GRAOUND WATER .<br />\n<br />\nOrganic soil forms can be further divided into \"recalcitrant carbon\" or resistant to decay, like humus, and \"labile carbon,\" where the carbon is both bioavailable (in the form of easily degraded compounds such as oils, sugars and alcohols) and physically accessible to microbes (not bound up with minerals).<br />\n<br />\nThe organic carbon pool includes both the living bodies and the dead, decomposing bodies of bacteria, fungi, insects and worms, along with plant debris and manure<br />\n<br />\nIndian topsoil was 6 feet deep\u2014unlike other nations of this planet having a few inches deep top soil.<br />\n<br />\nModern, chemically-based GM agriculture depletes soil carbon..<br />\n<br />\nWHAT IS GOOD FOR ISRAEL IS NOT GOOD FOR INDIA\u2014 JEW DARLING PM MODI PLEASE NOTE. WE WONT ALLOW YOUR MANN KE TAMANNA \u201cKOSHER COMPUTER COW\u201d IN INDIA..<br />\n<br />\nSoil building is the product of a self-reinforcing, positive feedback loop. But soil decline is also a self-reinforcing loop that can result in catastrophic soil loss.<br />\n<br />\nNitrogen fertilizers combined with tillage accelerate microbial respiration, burning up soil carbon faster than it is replaced. Due to the loss of organic carbon reservoirs, many soils have become nearly lifeless substrates that must be continually fed with irrigation water, mineral nutrients and pesticides to produce a crop. Although productive in the short term, this practice is not sustainable<br />\n<br />\nThe desh drohi GREEN REVOLUTION has caused our holy topsoil to lose 80% of their original soil organic carbon (SOC) pool.<br />\n<br />\nWE DON\u2019T WANT COMMIES AND WHITE JEWS TO DRIVE OUR EDUCATION<br />\n<br />\nBiochar serves as an electron buffer for redox reactions and helps bacteria swap electrons among themselves, improving their metabolic efficiency as a microbial community.. With its pores and its electrical charges, biochar is capable of both aBsorption and aDsorption.. The surfaces of biochar, both internal and external, aDsorb materials by electro-chemical bonds, working like an electric sponge.<br />\n<br />\nBiochar surfaces adsorb carbon and retain it in compounds with minerals, supporting at the same time a large microbial community that potentially makes more efficient use of organic debris containing carbon and other nutrients.<br />\nbalanced compost, with the optimum C:N ratio, will contain lots of humus. However, if there is not enough stable carbon (from wood, straw or other lignin sources), then the easily degradable sugars, fats and proteins will be completely consumed by microbes leaving very little substrate behind<br />\n<br />\nBoth biochar and compost increases cation exchange capacity (CEC - the ability to hold onto and transfer nutrient cations: ammonium, calcium, magnesium, and potassium)\u2026<br />\n<br />\nThey supports soil microbial life and biodiversity and helps plants resist diseases and pathogens. They add humus carbon to the soil carbon pool, reducing the atmospheric carbon pool\u2014and increases soil water holding capacity. In coastal areas they help plants grow better in high salt situations.<br />\n<br />\nUnlike biochar, compost is quickly broken down by microbial action in soil over months to at most, decades, depending primarily on climate. Biochar lasts at least ten times longer in most soils.. Biochar is effective at retaining nitrogen in soils and there is NO need for CHEMICAL UREA.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS THE ONLY INTELLIGENT WAY TO PREVENT FARMER SUICIDES.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3--</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_138MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_138BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_138B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_139B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8131227607787448028\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_139M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/08/the-thin-red-line-movie-review.html?showComment=1501992304276#c8131227607787448028\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">August 6, 2017 at 9:35 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_139MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2--<br />\n<br />\nAdding biochar to compost reduced the amount of dissolved organic carbon (labile carbon) in mature compost while increasing the fraction of stable humic materials (stable carbon).<br />\n<br />\nThe desh drohi GREEN REVOLUTION has left us with a rapidly deteriorating climate, and soils that are dying and eroding. Biochar, as a form of recalcitrant carbon, is the medicine that DELIBERETELY degraded and unproductive Indian top soils need.<br />\n<br />\nRECENTLY OUR LOSER LAWYER TURNED COLLEGIUM JUDGES ( BOTTOM DREGS OF THE SCHOOL CEREBRAL BARRE ) BANNED BURNING OF CROP STUBBLE ( WHICH PRODUCES BIOCHAR ) BECAUSE OF DELHI SMOG.<br />\n<br />\nIF THIS IS THE CASE SHIFT THE CAPITAL OF INDIA TO A PLACE WHERE THERE IS NO TEMPERATURE INVERSION..<br />\n<br />\nTall grasses burn quick and hot, however, close to the ground where the roots start, air is excluded so the base of the grasses will pyrolyze and not burn. This kind of natural charcoal is present in the most valuable agricultural soils in the world<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/arctic-ice-melt-and-methane-time-bomb.html<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html<br />\n<br />\nWHITE REVOLUTION and GREEN REVOLUTION has bled Bharatmata with a million cuts\u2014 the deep wound are pus filled sores today .<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/nutritious-a1-milk-of-vedic-cows-with.html<br />\n<br />\nTHERE WAS A REASON WHY AGNIHOTRA WAS DONE IN ANCIENT TIMES IN INDIA.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/agnihotra-ghee-cow-dung-fuel-capt-ajit.html<br />\n<br />\nPUT THIS COMMENT IN THE WEBSITES OF PMO, PMMODI, EDUCATION MIISTER, HOME MIMISTER, FOOD MINISTER, HEALTH MINISTER, COAL MINISTER, FINANCE MINISTER, ENVIRONMENT MINISTER, LAW MINISTER CHIEF JUSTICE OF INDIA, AND WEBSITES OF DESH BHAKTS<br />\n<br />\nI ASK MY READERS \u2013 SPREAD THIS ON SOCIAL MEDIA. CARBON TAXES WERE COLLECTED BY WHITE JEWS WHO SANG ALL THE WAY TO THE BANK..</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">IN THE MONTH OF FEB 2018, EUROPE IS CODER THAN THE ARCTIC-- THESE SAME BASTARDS--THE SAME MOTHERFUCKERS ARE RESPONSIBLE..</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">THE GULF STREAM CURRENT HAS BECOME WARMER DUE TO METHANE IN THE WATER... WE ALL KNOW OF FRACKING IN USA AND DEEPWATER HORIZON OIL SPILL ...</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">AGAIN--THE BLAME IS ON INDIA-- INDIA MUST MOTH BALL COAL-- AND WE HAVE ROTHSCHILDs APCO BRANDED NARENDRA DAMODARDAS MODI PLAYING BALL..</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">THIS ILLITERATE KYBER PASS GUJJU NO 2 EVEN WROTE A BOOK ON CLIMATE CHANGE... MAY BE HE DOWNLOADED SUCH FANTASTIC KNOWLEDGE LIKE HOW THE MAHARISHIS DOWNLOADED THE VEDA SRUTIS FROM AKASHA...</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">SORRY-- WE THE PEOPLE OF INDIA WILL NOT ALLOW COAL TO BE MOTHBALLED IN INDIA--COME WHAT MAY.. WE CHOSE MODI AS PM FOR A FIVE YEAR TERM.. WE THE PEOPLE HAVE NOT SOLD BHARATMATA TO GUJJU NO 2 MODI...</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">Across the Arctic, temperatures are approximately three degrees Centigratde above normal, and the Arctic Ocean sea ice is at a record low for late February 2018.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">As frigid air sweeps across Europe, the Arctic itself is seeing an unprecedented warm spell.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">In northernmost Greenland, it was 6 degrees Celsius above zero yesterday. And it's consistently been above zero for the last fortnight.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">Over the pole from Europe, nearly a third of the ice covering the Bering Sea to the west of Alaska has also disappeared. But this was no gradual process; the ice retreated over an astonishing eight days in mid-February 2018.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">Arctic sea ice has been retreating at record rates-- and the blame is falling on CO2 and Indian coal ?</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">The Gulf Stream, carrying warm Atlantic water, moves north along the Norwegian coast and divides into two main branches, one on either side side of the island archipelago of Svalbard.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">In the Arctic Ocean, this Atlantic water becomes denser as it cools and therefore sinks. After circulating, the now cold water leaves the Arctic Ocean, mainly through the Fram Strait between Svalbard and Greenland.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">Shriveling sea ice also has turned the region into something of a new frontier.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">WHITE JEWS are eyeing the Arctic\u2019s opening sea routes, its strategic position between Eurasia and North America, and its potentially huge reserves of oil and gas, as well as other resources.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">A new enemy is undermining ice floating on the Arctic Ocean: heat from below.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">Warm Atlantic waters, delivered by an offshoot of the Gulf Stream, have long been known to prevent ice formation north of Scandinavia, on the western side of the Eurasian basin.</span><br />\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><br /></span>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">CONTINUED TO 2-</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_192BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><span id=\"bc_0_192b+seedSVPD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_191T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><span id=\"bc_0_192b+seedSVPD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_191TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_191TN\"></span></span></span><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_191TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><span id=\"bc_0_192b+seedSVPD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_191TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_191TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><span id=\"bc_0_192b+seedSVPD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_191TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_191TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span></span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_191TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><span id=\"bc_0_192b+seedSVPD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_191B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3265753235317032373\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_191M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/02/britannia-did-not-rule-waves-and-this.html?showComment=1519818570561#c3265753235317032373\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 28, 2018 at 5:19 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_191MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nSatellite data show that, in general, sea ice is much more prevalent in the eastern side of the basin, north of Siberia. But over the last decade, ice has also begun to disappear here, too. It used to persist through the sunny summers, allowing several years of ice growth to accumulate.<br />\n<br />\nNow, the ice melts in summer, causing the total time without floating ice in the region to jump from less than 1 month per year to more than three.<br />\n<br />\nBetween Norway and Greenland in the western Eurasian basin, Atlantic currents flow into the Arctic at a depth of 200 to 250 meters, about 4\u00b0C warmer than the surface water. In winter, cold air cools surface waters until they fall and mix with the warm waters below.<br />\n<br />\nThat creates an overall warmer, well-mixed ocean over the top 250 meters, and one with little sea ice.<br />\n<br />\nOn the eastern side of the basin, however, the warm Atlantic waters were kept at bay\u2014until recently.<br />\n<br />\nThe currents lurked at a depth of about 150 meters, but they didn\u2019t mix much with surface layers, because of a barrier called the cold halocline layer (CHL)\u2014a boundary between salty deep waters and fresher water on top. Summer ice, as it forms, rejects salt, leading to the creation of dense, salty waters just below the ice.<br />\n<br />\nThose waters are heavier, and as they fall they create a highly stratified ocean.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nThe top of the Atlantic water, according to one mooring, had risen from a depth of 150 meters in the winter of 2003 to a depth of 70 meters just a decade later. Without summer sea ice forming to establish the CHL, he says, the ocean mixes more\u2014and less ice forms.<br />\n<br />\nA positive feedback loop is underway, in which less summer sea ice will lead to warmer winter waters and even less summer ice in subsequent years..<br />\n<br />\nBASTARDS !<br />\n<br />\nMOTHER FUCKERS !<br />\n<br />\nAAARRRGGHH PPTTHHEEOOOYYYYYYYYY !!!<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/arctic-ice-melt-and-methane-time-bomb.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html</span><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><span id=\"bc_0_192b+seedSVPD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\"><span id=\"bc_0_192b+seedSVPD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_140b+seedE0TbD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_163M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/03/treason-from-within-biggest-cut-on.html?showComment=1521214252772#c9105617547092292125\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">March 16, 2018 at 9:00 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_163MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nDUE TO METHANE LEAKS FROM US FRACKING THE GULF STREAM IS NOW METHANE LADEN MAKING IT WARMER AND CAUSED IT TO SHIFT ITS ORIGINAL COURSE WHICH EXISTED FROM THE BEGINNING OF TIME..<br />\n<br />\nThe Gulf Stream influences the climate of the east coast of North America from Florida to Newfoundland, and the west coast of Europe<br />\n<br />\nA warmer Arctic could halt the Gulf Stream, which brings warmer water and weather to north-western Europe. There\u2019s no land at the North Pole \u2014 it\u2019s a frozen ocean.<br />\n<br />\nIn winter in the Arctic it is complete darkness yet temperatures spiked 7.2 deg C The sun set in October 2017 and won\u2019t be seen until March 2018 , yet the thermometer reads like summer. Temperatures should be sub zero but are instead above the freezing point.<br />\n<br />\nThe extent of frozen seawater floating in the Arctic Ocean reached new lows in January / February in 4 decades of satellite monitoring.<br />\n<br />\nThe arctic was 6.1 degrees Celsius warmer than usual on February 2018<br />\n<br />\nFebruary 2018 also saw the greatest loss of Arctic sea ice since man came on earth.. Record-low levels of sea ice in the Bering Sea and the Arctic are shattering all known records.<br />\n<br />\nWarming Arctic decreases the strength of the jet stream. This air current acts like a tourniquet keeping Arctic air from bleeding out over North America.<br />\n<br />\nThe extreme weather that has brought snow and bitter cold to much of Europe in recent days is part of a remarkable temperature inversion that has also enveloped the Arctic with unprecedented warmth.<br />\n<br />\nThinner, receding ice allows the ocean\u2019s heat to escape more readily into the atmosphere, which the Arctic\u2019s highly stable lower atmosphere traps near the surface during the polar night. As a result, winter surface air temperatures have warmed more in the Arctic compared with the global average.<br />\nThinner sea ice is more mobile and deforms more easily from winds and currents. In February, southerly surface winds blew sea ice away from the northern shore of Greenland, causing the largest expanse of open ocean in winter ever recorded by satellites. S imilarly, the Bering Sea experienced extreme sea ice retreat this winter.<br />\n<br />\nWith more open ocean, major wind storms generate large waves that cause damaging coastal erosion, endangering oceanside towns.<br />\n<br />\nIn January 2018, the eastern US and Canada suffered a record-breaking \u201cpolar vortex\u201d that brought plunging temperatures and led Niagara Falls to freeze.<br />\n<br />\nA polar vortex is a mass of cold air that sits above the Earth\u2019s north and south poles. This cold air is controlled by a large pocket of low pressure, which rotates in an anti-clockwise direction at the North Pole and clockwise at the South Pole.<br />\n<br />\nA polar vortex is an upper level low-pressure area lying near the Earth's poles. There are two polar vortices in the Earth's atmosphere, overlying the North and South Poles. It ALWAYS exists near the poles, but weakens in summer and strengthens in winter. The term \"vortex\" refers to the counter-clockwise flow of air that helps keep the colder air near the Poles.<br />\n<br />\nThe jet stream is strongest in winter, when it has the greatest effect on weather in more densely populated parts of North America and Eurasia.<br />\n<br />\nWhen it rolls along in relatively steady waves, normal weather ensues, with spells of cold, snow and intermittent warm-ups.<br />\n<br />\nBut when it coils far to the south, bitter cold Arctic air spills southward along with it. Wriggling like a garden hose, each southward kink in the wind tends to be balanced out by a northward bend somewhere else. That can lead to the western states, even Alaska, being unusually warm and dry while the middle of the country and the eastern states freeze.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_163BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_163b+seedZT8D\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_162T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_163b+seedZT8D\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_162TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_162TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_162TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_163b+seedZT8D\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_162TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_162TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_163b+seedZT8D\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_162TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_162TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_162TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_162B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4839838696655631073\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_162M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/03/treason-from-within-biggest-cut-on.html?showComment=1521214280038#c4839838696655631073\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">March 16, 2018 at 9:01 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_162MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nNorthern jet stream would start shifting southward, which would bring cold polar air with it, causing colder and snowier North American winters. Loss of Arctic sea ice shifts the jet stream further south than normal resulting in increased rain during the summer in northwest Europe.<br />\n<br />\nNormally, when the vortex is strong and healthy, it helps keep a current of air known as the jet stream traveling around the globe in a pretty circular path. This current keeps the cold air up north and the warm air down south.<br />\n<br />\nBut without that strong low-pressure system, the jet stream doesn\u2019t have much to keep it in line. It becomes wavy and rambling. Put a couple of areas of high-pressure systems in its way, and all of a sudden you have a river of cold air being pushed down south along with the rest of the polar vortex system.<br />\n<br />\nWhen polar ice melts, more warmth escapes from the ocean into the air \u2014 which can affect the atmosphere up to 30km high, weakening the polar vortex.<br />\n<br />\nThis allows frigid air to break out of the Arctic and threaten Russia and Europe with cold extremes<br />\n<br />\nLarge quantities of methane are stored in the Arctic in natural gas deposits, permafrost, and as undersea clathrates. Permafrost and clathrates degrade on warming, thus large releases of methane from these sources<br />\n<br />\nThe release of methane from the Arctic is in itself a major contributor to global warming as a result of polar amplification.<br />\n<br />\nSea ice, and the cold conditions it sustains, serves to stabilise methane deposits on and near the shoreline, preventing the clathrate breaking down and outgassing methane into the atmosphere, causing further warming.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_163b+seedZT8D\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<br style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px;\" /><br />\n<ol id=\"bc_0_108TB\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_107B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1775047922983490740\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_107M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/08/the-deep-state-and-shadow-government_4.html?showComment=1533544271998#c1775047922983490740\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">August 6, 2018 at 2:01 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_107MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-45070498<br /><br />I HAD WARNED SEVERAL TIMES --<br /><br />DO NOT FUCK AROUND WITH THE FLOW OF THE GULF STREAM<br /><br />USA IS THE CULPRIT FOR THE MASSIVE HEAT WAVE IN EUROPE<br /><br />METHANE LADEN GULF STREAM HAS SLOWED DOWN AND IS NOW 20% WEAKER THAT THE PRE-OIL FRACKING ERA ..<br /><br />GULF STREAM IS A CRITICAL COMPONENT OF THE AMOC ( Atlantic meridional overturning circulation )..<br /><br />The AMOC is an important component of the Earth\u2019s climate system-- and it is dangerous if it slows down further..<br /><br />the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (Amoc), carries warm water northwards towards the north pole. There it cools, becomes denser and sinks, and then flows back southwards.<br /><br />THE DEEP STATE ENSURED THAT CARBON DI OXIDE IS THE CULPRIT AT PARIS COP21 --SO THAT THEY CAN MAKE MONEY FROM CARBON TAXES.. THE GANG OF BIG BROTHER KICKED METHANE AND NITROUS OXIDE UNDER THE KOSHER CARPET..<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html</span><br /><br />ARCTIC AND GREENLAND ICE MELTING HAS CAUSED WEAKENING OF AMOC..<br /><br />The Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC) is one part of the larger global thermohaline circulation. The circulation is powered by regional differences in the temperature and salinity of the ocean, with water flowing to try to balance out these difference.<br /><br />A large addition of cold fresh water from melting Greenland ice sheets to the warm salty surface water typically found in the North Atlantic would cancel out some of these differences, weakening the strength of the circulation.<br /><br />The effect of Greenland ice melt has not been widely included in previous studies of the AMOC because ice melt predictions are generally not included in climate models.<br /><br />Scientists don\u2019t fully understand the AMOC itself and how it might respond to not only an influx of fresh water, but also to shifting winds, rising sea levels, and changes in atmospheric and ocean temperatures.</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">A catastrophic collapse of the AMOC can cause a stratification of the ocean with cold water on top and warm water on the bottom. a PARADOX..</span></div>\n<div>\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/12/arctic-ice-melt-and-methane-time-bomb.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html</span><br /><br />THE NORTHWARD FLOWING GULF STREAM ( EAST COAST USA ) CONTAINS METHANE DUE TO FRACKING LEAKS..<br /><br />THE WARM GULF STREAM HAS SLOWED DOWN..<br /><br />THE THERMOHALINE OCEAN CIRCULATION HAS NOW GONE HAYWIRE\u2026<br /><br />JET STREAM IS JUMPING LIKE A MONKEY AND HAS COME CLOSER TO THE EQUATOR FOR THE FIRST TIME SINCE MAN CAME ON EARTH..<br /><br />ARCTIC WILL LOSE ALMOST ALL SEA ICE SOON, WHILE THE ANTARCTIC ICE IS BUILDING UP\u2026<br /><br />CONDITIONS ARE RIPE FOR A PLANET AXIS TILT WOBBLE\u2026<br /><br />This will trigger massive earthquakes that will destabilize methane hydrates and result in huge amounts of methane abruptly entering the atmosphere-- this was how dinosaurs disappeared..<br /><br /><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">AGAIN, THE GULF STREAM CURRENT HAS BECOME WARMER DUE TO METHANE IN THE WATER... WE ALL KNOW OF FRACKING IN USA AND DEEPWATER HORIZON OIL SPILL .</span></b>..<br /><br />AGAIN--THE BLAME IS ON INDIA-- INDIA MUST MOTH BALL COAL-- AND WE HAVE ROTHSCHILDs APCO BRANDED NARENDRA DAMODARDAS MODI PLAYING BALL..<br /><br />CONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_107BR\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_107b+seedGDWD\" kind=\"d\"><div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_106T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_106TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_106B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4459411171110684722\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_106M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/08/the-deep-state-and-shadow-government_4.html?showComment=1533544331021#c4459411171110684722\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">August 6, 2018 at 2:02 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_106MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br /><br />INDIA DID NOT HAVE A VOICE IN PARIS COP 21 -- WE WERE SILENT ABOUT METHANE AND NITROUS OXIDE EMISSIONS BY THE WEST . . CHITPAVAN PRAKASH JAVEDEKAR WAS GRINNING LIKE A CHESHIRE CAT WHENEVER HE SAW A WHITE JEW..<br /><br />Between Norway and Greenland in the western Eurasian basin, Atlantic currents flow into the Arctic at a depth of 200 to 250 meters, about 4\u00b0C warmer than the surface water. In winter, cold air cools surface waters until they fall and mix with the warm waters below. ..<br /><br />That creates an overall warmer, well-mixed ocean over the top 250 meters, and one with little sea ice\u2026<br /><br />On the eastern side of the basin, however, the warm Atlantic waters were kept at bay\u2014until recently. ..<br /><br />The currents lurked at a depth of about 150 meters, but they didn\u2019t mix much with surface layers, because of a barrier called the cold halocline layer (CHL)\u2014a boundary between salty deep waters and fresher water on top. Summer ice, as it forms, rejects salt, leading to the creation of dense, salty waters just below the ice. ..<br /><br />Those waters are heavier, and as they fall they create a highly stratified ocean\u2026<br /><br />capt ajit vadakayil<br />..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</span></div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZgD8tJ62UNY/V2Ha6YFMocI/AAAAAAABKA4/FrMbT4PEp-4ZjFtI2RaJvf6jAO8TaMWtACLcB/s1600/capt%2Bajit%2Bvadak2ayil%2B2.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ZgD8tJ62UNY/V2Ha6YFMocI/AAAAAAABKA4/FrMbT4PEp-4ZjFtI2RaJvf6jAO8TaMWtACLcB/s320/capt%2Bajit%2Bvadak2ayil%2B2.JPG\" width=\"200\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt.
